sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva — if so, let the Merciful One write “to her” and be silent; “he shall become impure” — for what do I need it? Learn from it.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתַב ״לָהּ״, כְּתַב נָמֵי ״יִטַּמָּא״. לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael Since wrote: “For her,” also wrote: “May he become impure,” for as was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated, was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmaʿel, since it is written “lah,” it wrote also “yitamma.” According to that which is taught in the house of Rabbi Yishmaʿel. For it was taught in the house of Rabbi Yishmaʿel: Any parashah that was said and was repeated, it was not repeated except for the sake of a matter that was renewed in it.

sentences.text: ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ — רְשׁוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה.
sentences.human_translation: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” optional; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: mandatory,
sentences.llm_translation: “‘Le-olam bahem ta‘avodu’ — permission, the words of Rabbi Yishma‘el. Rabbi ‘Akiva says: obligation.”

sentences.text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה כׇּל נְשָׁמָה״, אִיצְטְרִיךְ נָמֵי לְמִיכְתַּב ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״, לְמִישְׁרֵי אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? Since it is written “You shall save alive nothing that breathes” it was necessary to write: “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” as well, to permit one from any of the nations who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Canaanite woman and she bore him a child. that you are permitted to purchase
sentences.llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishma’el? — Since it is written: “You shall not let live any soul,” it was necessary also to write: “Forever in them you shall serve,” to permit one from all the nations who came upon the Kena’anit and begot from her a son, that you are permitted to acquire him.

sentences.text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֶחָד מִן הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״.
sentences.human_translation: as it is taught From where that one from the nations who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Canaanite woman, and she bore him a child, that you are permitted to purchase as a slave? The verse states: “Moreover, of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them may you buy”
sentences.llm_translation: As it is taught: From where is it derived with regard to one of the ummot who came upon the Kena’anit and begot from her a son, that you are permitted to acquire him as an eved? The verse teaches to say: “And also from the children of the toshavim who sojourn with you, from them you shall acquire.”

sentences.text: יָכוֹל אַף הַכְּנַעֲנִי שֶׁבָּא עַל אַחַת מִן הָאוּמּוֹת וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר הוֹלִידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶם״, מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם, וְלֹא מִן הַגָּרִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם.
sentences.human_translation: might even a Canaanite who engaged in sexual intercourse with a woman from the nations and she bore him a child, that you are permitted to purchase as a slave, the verse states: “Which they have given birth to in your land,” from the born in your land but not from the reside in your land,
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Could it be, even the Kena‘ani who came upon one of the ummot and begot from her a son, that you are permitted to acquire him as an ‘eved? The Talmud says: “whom they begot in your land”; from those born in your land, and not from the gerim in your land.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִ״מֵּהֶם תִּקְנוּ״ נָפְקָא, ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״ לְמָה לִי — לְחוֹבָה.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva derives from “Of them may you buy.” why do I “Of them may you take your bondmen forever” to mandatory
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi ʿAkiva—from “from them you shall acquire” it emerges; “forever with them you shall work” why do I need it?—for obligation.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בָּהֶם״ — וְלֹא בְּאַחֵיכֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael “of them,” but not of your brethren,
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmaʿel: “bahem” — and not with your brothers.

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּאַחֵיכֶם — מִסֵּיפָא דִּקְרָא נָפְקָא: ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו לֹא תִרְדֶּה בוֹ בְּפָרֶךְ״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva your brethren is derived from the latter of the verse, “But over your brethren the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with rigor”
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva: “with your brothers” — from the latter clause of the verse it emerges: “And with your brothers, the children of Yisrael, a man with his brother you shall not rule over him with harsh labor.”

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם״, כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״בָּהֶם״. לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael since it is written: “But over your brethren,” it also writes “of them,” because of that was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated, was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
sentences.llm_translation: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: And Rabbi Yishmaʿel: אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם״, Since it is written “and with your brothers,” כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״בָּהֶם״. it is written also “in them.” לְכִדְתָנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. according to that which was taught of the house of Rabbi Yishmaʿel. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: For it was taught of the house of Rabbi Yishmaʿel: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִישְׁנֵית, Any parashah that was said and was repeated, לֹא נִישְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ. was not repeated except on account of a matter that was renewed in it.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זְנוּתָא בְּבֵיתָא כִּי קַרְיָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמָא. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: תּוּקְפָּא בְּבֵיתָא כִּי קַרְיָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמָא. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּאִיתְּתָא, אֲבָל בְּגַבְרָא לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Licentious in a home like a worm [ karya ] to sesame [ shumeshema ]. And Rav Ḥisda says: Anger in a home like a worm to sesame. this and that, with regard to the woman but with regard to the man, we do not have with regard to it,
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר Rav Ḥisda: Z’nuta in the house is like a worm to sesame. וְאָמַר Rav Ḥisda: Tukpa in the house is like a worm to sesame. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי—both this and that—are in a woman, but in a man we have not in it.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּתְּחִילָּה, קוֹדֶם שֶׁחָטְאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, הָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה עִם כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מִתְהַלֵּךְ בְּקֶרֶב מַחֲנֶךָ״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁחָטְאוּ נִסְתַּלְּקָה שְׁכִינָה מֵהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִרְאֶה בְךָ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר וְשָׁב מֵאַחֲרֶיךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says: Initially, before the Jewish people sinned, the Divine Presence resided with each and every one as it is stated: “For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp” Once they sinned, the Divine Presence withdrew from them, as it is stated “That He see no unseemly matter in you, and turn away from you”
sentences.llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: At the beginning, before Israel sinned, the Shekhina was dwelling with each and every one, as it is said: “For the LORD your God walks in the midst of your camp.” Once they sinned, the Shekhina withdrew from them, as it is said: “And He shall not see in you the nakedness of a thing, and turn back from behind you.”

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְקַדַּמְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ״. וְכׇל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְלַפַּפְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לְיוֹם הַדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִלָּפְתוּ אׇרְחוֹת דַּרְכָּם יַעֲלוּ בַתֹּהוּ וְיֹאבֵדוּ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Anyone who fulfills one mitzva in this world, precedes him and goes before him to the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And your righteousness shall go before you, And anyone who commits one transgression in this world, it shrouds him and goes before him to the Day of Judgment, as it is stated: “The paths of their way do wind, they go up into the waste, and are lost”
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: Rabbi Shemu’el bar Naḥmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — anyone who does one mitzvah in this world — מְקַדַּמְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, it precedes him and goes before him to the World-to-Come, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: as it is said: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ״ “and your righteousness shall go before you.” וְכׇל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — and anyone who transgresses one transgression in this world — מְלַפַּפְתּוֹ וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְפָנָיו לְיוֹם הַדִּין, it wraps him and goes before him to the Day of Judgment, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: as it is said: ״יִלָּפְתוּ אׇרְחוֹת דַּרְכָּם יַעֲלוּ בַתֹּהוּ וְיֹאבֵדוּ״ “the paths of their way are wrapped; they go up into chaos and are lost.”

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: קְשׁוּרָה בּוֹ כְּכֶלֶב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא שָׁמַע אֵלֶיהָ לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״. ״לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ״ — בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״ — לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: is chained to him like a dog, as it is stated “That he listened not to her, to lie by her, or to be with her” “to lie by her” in this world, “to be with her” to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Bound to him like a dog, as it is said: “And he did not listen to her, to lie beside her, to be with her.” “To lie beside her” — in this world; “to be with her” — for the World-to-Come.

sentences.text: תְּנַן הָתָם, שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין:
sentences.human_translation: We learned elsewhere as, by right, should have been
sentences.llm_translation: We learned there, that it was in the law:

sentences.text: וּמָה עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת הָאַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
sentences.human_translation: And just as the first testimony which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is not established with fewer than two the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it not be established with fewer than two
sentences.llm_translation: And what of the first testimony, that its prohibition is not a prohibition forever — it does not stand with fewer than two; the latter testimony, that its prohibition is a prohibition forever — is it not דין that it should not stand with fewer than two?

sentences.text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: the verse states: “And there is no witness against her” any that there is against her
sentences.llm_translation: Talmud to say: “and a witness there is not in her,” all that there is in her.

sentences.text: וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה עֵדוּת הָאַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּעֵד אֶחָד, עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּתְקַיֵּים בְּעֵד אֶחָד?
sentences.human_translation: And now an a fortiori with regard to the first testimony And just as the final testimony which forbids her an irrevocable prohibition, is established with one witness, the first testimony, which does not forbid her an irrevocable prohibition, is it not logical that it should be established with one witness?
sentences.llm_translation: And an a fortiori to the first testimony from now: And just as the later testimony, that you forbid her a prohibition of forever — is upheld with one witness, the first testimony, that you do not forbid her a prohibition of forever — is it not law that it be upheld with one witness?

sentences.text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״. מָה ״דָּבָר״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, אַף כָּאן — עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: the verse states: because he has found some unseemly matter [ davar ] about her” and there, it states: “By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter [ davar ] be established” just as “matter” stated there by the mouth of two witnesses, so too here, by the mouth of two
sentences.llm_translation: Talmud to say: “for he has found in her *ervat davar*,” and there, he says: “by the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses a matter shall stand.” Just as “matter” said there — by the mouth of two witnesses, so too here — by the mouth of two.

sentences.text: הַאי מִ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״ נָפְקָא? מִ״בָּהּ״ נָפְקָא: בָּהּ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, בָּהּ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
sentences.human_translation: this derived from: “Because he has found some unseemly matter about her” It is derived from: against her [ bah ]” With regard to it, but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion. should have
sentences.llm_translation: This “from: ‘because he has found in her ʿervat davar’ ”—does it go out? From “in her” it goes out: “in her”—and not with kinui, “in her”—and not with setirah—he needs it!

sentences.text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בָּהּ״: בָּהּ — וְלֹא בְּקִינּוּי, בָּהּ — וְלֹא בִּסְתִירָה.
sentences.human_translation: That is also what he is saying. The verse states: against her [ bah ],” With regard to it [ bah ], but not with regard to warning. With regard to it, but not with regard to seclusion.
sentences.llm_translation: So too he is saying: *Talmud* to say “**bah**”: **bah** — and not with a *kinnuy*, **bah** — and not in concealment.

sentences.text: וְטוּמְאָה בְּעָלְמָא בְּלֹא קִינּוּי וּבְלֹא סְתִירָה, דְּלָא מְהֵימַן עֵד אֶחָד, מְנָלַן? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״כִּי מָצָא בָהּ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים אוֹ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יָקוּם דָּבָר״. מָה ״דָּבָר״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — עֵדִים שְׁנַיִם, אַף כָּאן — עֵדִים שְׁנַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: And defilement in general, without warning and without seclusion, from where do we that one witness is not deemed credible? Here it is stated: “Because he has found some unseemly matter about her” and there it is stated: “By the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established” just as “matter” stated there two witnesses, so too here, two witnesses.
sentences.llm_translation: And impurity in general, without kinui and without setirah, that one witness is not believed— from where do we derive it? It is said here: “for he has found in her a matter of nakedness,” and it is said there: “by the mouth of two witnesses or by the mouth of three witnesses shall a matter be established.” Just as “matter” said there— two witnesses, so too here— two witnesses.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵי זוֹ הִיא עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — זוֹ עֵדוּת סְתִירָה, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה — זוֹ עֵדוּת טוּמְאָה.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught which is the first testimony? This testimony of seclusion. the final testimony? This testimony of defilement.
sentences.llm_translation: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: The Rabbis taught: אֵי זוֹ הִיא עֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — Which is the first testimony? — זוֹ עֵדוּת סְתִירָה, This is testimony of seclusion; עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה — The later testimony — זוֹ עֵדוּת טוּמְאָה. This is testimony of tum’ah.

text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה? כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, כְּדֵי בִיאָה, כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה.
כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ.

בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִרְמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִקְשׁוֹר גַּרְדִּי נִימָא.

חָנִין בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ לִיטּוֹל קֵיסָם. פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לַסַּל לִיטּוֹל כִּכָּר. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.
וְכׇל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי?
צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי טוּמְאָתָהּ וְאַרְצוּתָהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי בִיאָה.
וְאִי תְּנָא כְּדֵי בִיאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי גְּמַר בִּיאָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה.
וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה וְאַרְצוּתָהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה. וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי [הַעֲרָאָה] — כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל.

וּרְמִינְהִי ״וְנִסְתְּרָה״, וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר — כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, כְּדֵי בִיאָה, כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה, כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.

רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ.

קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין: הַיְינוּ הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, הַיְינוּ חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל. הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, וּפְלִיג רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֲלֵיהּ. הָכָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל!
אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל, חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ.
בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאָזֵיל וַהֲדַר אָתֵי, אוֹ דִילְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי וַהֲדַר קָאֵי בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ. תֵּיקוּ.
הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס, הָכָא: כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל! אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.

הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס! אֵימָא כְּדֵי לִמְזוֹג וְלִשְׁתּוֹת. וְלֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא! אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
הָתָם אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.

הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה! אֵימָא כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה וּלְגוֹמְעָהּ. וְלֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא! אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ בֶּן עַזַּאי.

הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא: כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ! לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קָאָמַר, דְּקָאָמַר מְשַׁעֲרִין בִּצְלִיאָה וּבִגְמִיעָה: אֵימָא שִׁיעוּר גְּמִיעָה לְחוֹדַהּ כְּדֵי לִגְמֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ, דְּהַיְינוּ צְלִיאָה וּגְמִיעָה.
רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִרְמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּקְשׁוֹר גַּרְדִּי נִימָא. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְרַחַק, אוֹ דִּמְקָרַב? תֵּיקוּ.
חָנִין בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ לִיטּוֹל קֵיסָם. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְהַדַּק אוֹ דְּלָא מְהַדַּק? תֵּיקוּ.
פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לַסַּל לִיטּוֹל כִּכָּר. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְהַדַּק אוֹ דְּלָא מְהַדַּק? בְּחַדְתָּא אוֹ בְּעַתִּיקָא? בְּחַמִּימָא אוֹ בְּקָרִירָא?
human_translation: And what is the measure of seclusion, equivalent defilement, equivalent intercourse, equivalent initial stage of intercourse.
equivalent circling a palm the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Eliezer says: equivalent for mixing a cup Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent to drink

Ben Azzai says: equivalent to roast an egg. Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to swallow it. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow three eggs one after another. Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: equivalent a weaver [ gardi ] to tie a string [ nima ].

Ḥanin ben Pineḥas says: equivalent that may extend her hand into her mouth to remove a wood chip Peleimu says: equivalent that she may extend her hand into a basket to take a loaf Although there is no proof for the matter, an allusion to the matter “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread”
And why do I all these
are necessary, as if taught Equivalent defilement, I would say equivalent her defilement and her appeasement, teaches us equivalent sexual intercourse
And if taught equivalent sexual intercourse, I would say equivalent completion of intercourse. teaches us equivalent initial stage of intercourse.

And if taught equivalent initial stage of intercourse, I would say equivalent initial stage of intercourse and her appeasement. teaches us equivalent defilement, And what is the measure equivalent initial stage of intercourse? equivalent circling a palm

And raises a contradiction “And she was secretly” and we have not heard what is the measure seclusion. When it says “And she was defiled you must say equivalent defilement, equivalent sexual intercourse, equivalent initial stage of intercourse, equivalent returning of a palm the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent mixing a cup Ben Azzai says: equivalent to drink Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to roast an egg. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow it.

enter our mind circling a palm tree is returning of a palm There, Rabbi Yishmael says equivalent circling a palm and Rabbi Eliezer disagreed with him, here, Rabbi Eliezer says equivalent returning of a palm
Abaye says: circling by foot, returning by the wind
Rav Ashi asks: returning by the wind, so that it goes and returns Or perhaps so that it goes and comes back and returns settles in its place. shall stand
There, Rabbi Eliezer says: equivalent for pouring a cup Here, equivalent returning of a palm This and that are one, measure.
There, Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent drinking Here, he says: equivalent mixing a cup Say equivalent to mix and drink let us say this and that are one measure? If so, this is Rabbi Eliezer
There, ben Azzai says: equivalent to roast an egg. Here, he says: equivalent to drink This and that are one measure.

There, Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to swallow Here, he says: equivalent to roast an egg. Say equivalent to roast an egg and to swallow it. let us say this and that are one measure? If so, this is ben Azzai

There, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow three eggs one after another. Here, he says: equivalent to swallow stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who stated measures for roasting and swallowing. Say measure swallowing alone, equivalent swallow three eggs one after another, which is roasting and swallowing,
Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: equivalent a weaver to tie a string. Rav Ashi asks: where are far or where are near shall stand
Ḥanin ben Pineḥas says: equivalent that may extend her hand into her mouth to remove a wood chip Rav Ashi asks: where is stuck or where is not stuck? shall stand
Peleimu says: equivalent that may extend her hand into a basket to take a loaf Rav Ashi asks: where adheres or where does not adhere? where new, or where old where hot or where cold
llm_translation: And how much is the measure of seclusion? Enough for defilement, enough for intercourse, enough for initial penetration.
As much as the encircling of a deqel, the words of Rabbi Yishmaʿel. Rabbi Eliʿezer says: as much as the mixing of the cup. Rabbi Yehoshuʿa says: as much as to drink it.

Ben Azzai says: enough to roast an egg. Rabbi Akiva says: enough to swallow it. Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says: enough to swallow three eggs, this after this. Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: enough to tie a weaver’s thread.

Ḥanin ben Pinḥas says: so that she will extend her hand into her mouth to take a splinter. Pleimo says: so that she will extend her hand to the basket to take a loaf. Even though there is no proof for the matter, a remembrance for the matter: “For on account of a harlot woman, unto a loaf of bread.”
And all these, for what are they for me?
Necessary; for if it was taught: enough for tum’ah, I would have said: enough for her tum’ah and her appeasement; it teaches us: enough for bi’ah.
And if he taught: enough time for bi’ah, I would have said: enough time for completion of bi’ah; he teaches us: enough time for ha’ara’ah.

And if He had let us hear: *kedei ha’ara’ah*, I would have said: *kedei ha’ara’ah* and its appeasement; it teaches us *kedei tum’ah*. And how much is *kedei* *ha’ara’ah* — *kedei* the encircling of a palm tree.

And raise a contradiction: “and she secluded herself,” and how much is the measure of seclusion we have not heard. When it says “and she became defiled,” you must say — enough for defilement, enough for intercourse, enough for ha‘ara’ah, enough for the turning back of a dekel, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.
Rabbi Yehoshu’a says: enough for the mixing of the cup. Ben Azzai says: enough to drink it. Rabbi Akiva says: enough to roast an egg. Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says: enough for a gulp.

It עולה upon our mind: this is the circling of a dekel, this is the returning of a dekel. There Rabbi Yishmaʿel said: enough for the circling of a dekel, and Rabbi Eliʿezer חולק upon him. Here Rabbi Eliʿezer said: enough for the returning of a dekel!
אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: Abaye said: הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל, striking with the foot; חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ, returning with the wind.
Rav Ashi inquired: Returning in the wind— is it as it goes and returns, or perhaps as it goes and comes and then stands again in its place? Teiku.
There, אמר Rabbi Eliezer: “as much as the mixing of the cup”; here: “as much as the returning of a dekel”! Both this and this—it is one measure.

There, Rabbi Yehoshua said: “in order to drink it”; here he said: “in order to mix the cup”! Say: in order to mix and to drink. And let him say: both this and that are one measure! If so, that is Rabbi Eliezer.
There, Ben Azzai said: enough to roast an egg; here he said: enough to drink it. Both this and that are one measure.

There, Rabbi Akiva said: “in order to swallow it”; here he said: “in order to roast an egg”! Say: in order to roast an egg and to swallow it. And let him say: this and this, it is one measure! If so, that is Ben Azzai.

There, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira said: in order to swallow three eggs, one after the other; here he said: in order to swallow it! He is saying it according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, for he said: they assess with roasting and with swallowing. Say: the measure of swallowing by itself is in order to swallow three eggs, one after the other, for that is roasting and swallowing.
Rabbi Elʿazar ben Yirmeya says: enough time that a gardi will tie a thread. Baʿei Rav Ashi: that he distances, or that he brings near? Teiku.
Ḥanin ben Pinḥas says: In order that she extend her hand into her mouth to take a splinter. Baʿei Rav Ashi: That it is tight, or that it is not tight? Teiku.
Peleimo says: so that she may extend her hand to the basket to take a loaf. Rav Ashi inquires: that it is tight or that it is not tight? with a new one or with an old one? with hot or with cold?

sentences.text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה? כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, כְּדֵי בִיאָה, כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה.
sentences.human_translation: And what is the measure of seclusion, equivalent defilement, equivalent intercourse, equivalent initial stage of intercourse.
sentences.llm_translation: And how much is the measure of seclusion? Enough for defilement, enough for intercourse, enough for initial penetration.

sentences.text: כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: equivalent circling a palm the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Eliezer says: equivalent for mixing a cup Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent to drink
sentences.llm_translation: As much as the encircling of a deqel, the words of Rabbi Yishmaʿel. Rabbi Eliʿezer says: as much as the mixing of the cup. Rabbi Yehoshuʿa says: as much as to drink it.

sentences.text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִרְמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִקְשׁוֹר גַּרְדִּי נִימָא.
sentences.human_translation: Ben Azzai says: equivalent to roast an egg. Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to swallow it. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow three eggs one after another. Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: equivalent a weaver [ gardi ] to tie a string [ nima ].
sentences.llm_translation: Ben Azzai says: enough to roast an egg. Rabbi Akiva says: enough to swallow it. Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says: enough to swallow three eggs, this after this. Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: enough to tie a weaver’s thread.

sentences.text: חָנִין בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ לִיטּוֹל קֵיסָם. פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לַסַּל לִיטּוֹל כִּכָּר. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.
sentences.human_translation: Ḥanin ben Pineḥas says: equivalent that may extend her hand into her mouth to remove a wood chip Peleimu says: equivalent that she may extend her hand into a basket to take a loaf Although there is no proof for the matter, an allusion to the matter “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread”
sentences.llm_translation: Ḥanin ben Pinḥas says: so that she will extend her hand into her mouth to take a splinter. Pleimo says: so that she will extend her hand to the basket to take a loaf. Even though there is no proof for the matter, a remembrance for the matter: “For on account of a harlot woman, unto a loaf of bread.”

sentences.text: וְכׇל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי?
sentences.human_translation: And why do I all these
sentences.llm_translation: And all these, for what are they for me?

sentences.text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי טוּמְאָתָהּ וְאַרְצוּתָהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי בִיאָה.
sentences.human_translation: are necessary, as if taught Equivalent defilement, I would say equivalent her defilement and her appeasement, teaches us equivalent sexual intercourse
sentences.llm_translation: Necessary; for if it was taught: enough for tum’ah, I would have said: enough for her tum’ah and her appeasement; it teaches us: enough for bi’ah.

sentences.text: וְאִי תְּנָא כְּדֵי בִיאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי גְּמַר בִּיאָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה.
sentences.human_translation: And if taught equivalent sexual intercourse, I would say equivalent completion of intercourse. teaches us equivalent initial stage of intercourse.
sentences.llm_translation: And if he taught: enough time for bi’ah, I would have said: enough time for completion of bi’ah; he teaches us: enough time for ha’ara’ah.

sentences.text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה וְאַרְצוּתָהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה. וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי [הַעֲרָאָה] — כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל.
sentences.human_translation: And if taught equivalent initial stage of intercourse, I would say equivalent initial stage of intercourse and her appeasement. teaches us equivalent defilement, And what is the measure equivalent initial stage of intercourse? equivalent circling a palm
sentences.llm_translation: And if He had let us hear: *kedei ha’ara’ah*, I would have said: *kedei ha’ara’ah* and its appeasement; it teaches us *kedei tum’ah*. And how much is *kedei* *ha’ara’ah* — *kedei* the encircling of a palm tree.

sentences.text: וּרְמִינְהִי ״וְנִסְתְּרָה״, וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר סְתִירָה לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר — כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה, כְּדֵי בִיאָה, כְּדֵי הַעֲרָאָה, כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
sentences.human_translation: And raises a contradiction “And she was secretly” and we have not heard what is the measure seclusion. When it says “And she was defiled you must say equivalent defilement, equivalent sexual intercourse, equivalent initial stage of intercourse, equivalent returning of a palm the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
sentences.llm_translation: And raise a contradiction: “and she secluded herself,” and how much is the measure of seclusion we have not heard. When it says “and she became defiled,” you must say — enough for defilement, enough for intercourse, enough for ha‘ara’ah, enough for the turning back of a dekel, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent mixing a cup Ben Azzai says: equivalent to drink Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to roast an egg. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow it.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshu’a says: enough for the mixing of the cup. Ben Azzai says: enough to drink it. Rabbi Akiva says: enough to roast an egg. Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira says: enough for a gulp.

sentences.text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין: הַיְינוּ הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, הַיְינוּ חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל. הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כְּדֵי הַקָּפַת דֶּקֶל, וּפְלִיג רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֲלֵיהּ. הָכָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל!
sentences.human_translation: enter our mind circling a palm tree is returning of a palm There, Rabbi Yishmael says equivalent circling a palm and Rabbi Eliezer disagreed with him, here, Rabbi Eliezer says equivalent returning of a palm
sentences.llm_translation: It עולה upon our mind: this is the circling of a dekel, this is the returning of a dekel. There Rabbi Yishmaʿel said: enough for the circling of a dekel, and Rabbi Eliʿezer חולק upon him. Here Rabbi Eliʿezer said: enough for the returning of a dekel!

sentences.text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל, חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye says: circling by foot, returning by the wind
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: Abaye said: הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל, striking with the foot; חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ, returning with the wind.

sentences.text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזָרָה בָּרוּחַ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאָזֵיל וַהֲדַר אָתֵי, אוֹ דִילְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי וַהֲדַר קָאֵי בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ. תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ashi asks: returning by the wind, so that it goes and returns Or perhaps so that it goes and comes back and returns settles in its place. shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Ashi inquired: Returning in the wind— is it as it goes and returns, or perhaps as it goes and comes and then stands again in its place? Teiku.

sentences.text: הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס, הָכָא: כְּדֵי חֲזָרַת דֶּקֶל! אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.
sentences.human_translation: There, Rabbi Eliezer says: equivalent for pouring a cup Here, equivalent returning of a palm This and that are one, measure.
sentences.llm_translation: There, אמר Rabbi Eliezer: “as much as the mixing of the cup”; here: “as much as the returning of a dekel”! Both this and this—it is one measure.

sentences.text: הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי מְזִיגַת הַכּוֹס! אֵימָא כְּדֵי לִמְזוֹג וְלִשְׁתּוֹת. וְלֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא! אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
sentences.human_translation: There, Rabbi Yehoshua says: equivalent drinking Here, he says: equivalent mixing a cup Say equivalent to mix and drink let us say this and that are one measure? If so, this is Rabbi Eliezer
sentences.llm_translation: There, Rabbi Yehoshua said: “in order to drink it”; here he said: “in order to mix the cup”! Say: in order to mix and to drink. And let him say: both this and that are one measure! If so, that is Rabbi Eliezer.

sentences.text: הָתָם אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לִשְׁתּוֹתוֹ. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.
sentences.human_translation: There, ben Azzai says: equivalent to roast an egg. Here, he says: equivalent to drink This and that are one measure.
sentences.llm_translation: There, Ben Azzai said: enough to roast an egg; here he said: enough to drink it. Both this and that are one measure.

sentences.text: הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה! אֵימָא כְּדֵי לִצְלוֹת בֵּיצָה וּלְגוֹמְעָהּ. וְלֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא! אִם כֵּן, הַיְינוּ בֶּן עַזַּאי.
sentences.human_translation: There, Rabbi Akiva says: equivalent to swallow Here, he says: equivalent to roast an egg. Say equivalent to roast an egg and to swallow it. let us say this and that are one measure? If so, this is ben Azzai
sentences.llm_translation: There, Rabbi Akiva said: “in order to swallow it”; here he said: “in order to roast an egg”! Say: in order to roast an egg and to swallow it. And let him say: this and this, it is one measure! If so, that is Ben Azzai.

sentences.text: הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא: כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ, הָכָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לְגוֹמְעָהּ! לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קָאָמַר, דְּקָאָמַר מְשַׁעֲרִין בִּצְלִיאָה וּבִגְמִיעָה: אֵימָא שִׁיעוּר גְּמִיעָה לְחוֹדַהּ כְּדֵי לִגְמֹעַ שָׁלֹשׁ בֵּיצִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ, דְּהַיְינוּ צְלִיאָה וּגְמִיעָה.
sentences.human_translation: There, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: equivalent to swallow three eggs one after another. Here, he says: equivalent to swallow stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who stated measures for roasting and swallowing. Say measure swallowing alone, equivalent swallow three eggs one after another, which is roasting and swallowing,
sentences.llm_translation: There, Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira said: in order to swallow three eggs, one after the other; here he said: in order to swallow it! He is saying it according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, for he said: they assess with roasting and with swallowing. Say: the measure of swallowing by itself is in order to swallow three eggs, one after the other, for that is roasting and swallowing.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יִרְמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּקְשׁוֹר גַּרְדִּי נִימָא. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְרַחַק, אוֹ דִּמְקָרַב? תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Yirmeya says: equivalent a weaver to tie a string. Rav Ashi asks: where are far or where are near shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elʿazar ben Yirmeya says: enough time that a gardi will tie a thread. Baʿei Rav Ashi: that he distances, or that he brings near? Teiku.

sentences.text: חָנִין בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיהָ לִיטּוֹל קֵיסָם. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְהַדַּק אוֹ דְּלָא מְהַדַּק? תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Ḥanin ben Pineḥas says: equivalent that may extend her hand into her mouth to remove a wood chip Rav Ashi asks: where is stuck or where is not stuck? shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: Ḥanin ben Pinḥas says: In order that she extend her hand into her mouth to take a splinter. Baʿei Rav Ashi: That it is tight, or that it is not tight? Teiku.

sentences.text: פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתּוֹשִׁיט יָדָהּ לַסַּל לִיטּוֹל כִּכָּר. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּמְהַדַּק אוֹ דְּלָא מְהַדַּק? בְּחַדְתָּא אוֹ בְּעַתִּיקָא? בְּחַמִּימָא אוֹ בְּקָרִירָא?
sentences.human_translation: Peleimu says: equivalent that may extend her hand into a basket to take a loaf Rav Ashi asks: where adheres or where does not adhere? where new, or where old where hot or where cold
sentences.llm_translation: Peleimo says: so that she may extend her hand to the basket to take a loaf. Rav Ashi inquires: that it is tight or that it is not tight? with a new one or with an old one? with hot or with cold?

text: בִּדְחִטֵּי אוֹ בְּדִשְׂעָרֵי? בְּרַכִּיכָא אוֹ בַּאֲקוֹשָׁא? תֵּיקוּ.
אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד — בְּעַצְמוֹ שִׁיעֵר. וְהָאִיכָּא בֶּן עַזַּאי דְּלָא נְסֵיב?
אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: נְסֵיב וּפֵירַשׁ הֲוָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו״.

דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, וְזִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל לֶחֶם בְּלֹא נְטִילַת יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.

אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״בְּעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״ — ״בְּעַד כִּכַּר לֶחֶם עַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה, לְסוֹף מְבַקֵּשׁ כִּכַּר לֶחֶם.

אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְּזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּשְׁפִּיל יָדָיו לְמַטָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁמָּא יֵצְאוּ הַמַּיִם חוּץ לַפֶּרֶק, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמַאי ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — לְבַסּוֹף נִכְשָׁל בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״.

אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. וְעוֹד: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.

אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״.
וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ כָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָם לְבָבֶךָ וְשָׁכַחְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״כִּי אֶת כׇּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חִדְלוּ לָכֶם מִן הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר נְשָׁמָה בְּאַפּוֹ כִּי בַּמֶּה נֶחְשָׁב הוּא״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בַּמֶּה״, אֶלָּא ״בָּמָה״.

מַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״? אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְנָהוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״הֲרִימֹתִי יָדִי אֶל ה׳ אֵל עֶלְיוֹן קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
קַשְׁיָא לְהוּ לִדְבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״, ״יָדִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
אֶלָּא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: אֲפִילּוּ קִיבֵּל תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד״, ״יָד מִיָּד״ מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!
אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: where of wheat, or where of barley, where soft, or where hard, shall stand
Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Each and every one estimated based on himself, But there is ben Azzai, who did not marry,
If you wish, say he was married and separated And if you wish, say he heard from his teacher. And if you wish, say “The counsel of the Lord is with them that fear Him”

Rav Avira interpreted homiletically; times he said in the name of Rabbi Ami and times he said it in the name of Rabbi Asi: anyone who eats bread without washing hands, as if engaged in sexual intercourse with a prostitute, as it is stated: “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread.”

Rava said: This “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread,” It should have “On account of a loaf a man is brought to a harlot.” Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with a harlot eventually beg a loaf of bread.

Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who treats washing hands with contempt is uprooted from the world. Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: first water, must raise his hands upward last water, must lower his hands downward. This is also taught One who washes his hands must raise his hands upward lest the water advance past the joint and return rendering hands ritually impure.
Rabbi Abbahu says: Anyone who eats bread without wiping hands as if he were eating impure bread, as it is stated: “And the Lord said: Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread unclean

And what “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any person who has arrogance within him will eventually stumble with an adulteress, as it is stated: “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life,”

Rava said: This “The precious life,” It should have An arrogant life. And further, it should have she hunts Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even studied Torah, about which it is written: “She is more precious than rubies [ peninim ]” than a High Priest, who enters the innermost sanctum, this will entrap him into the judgment of Gehenna,

Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Any person who has arrogance within him as if he were an idol worshipper, it is written here: “Everyone that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house”
And Rabbi Yoḥanan said his own as if he has denied the core as it is stated: “Then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the Lord your God”

Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: as if he engaged in sexual intercourse with all those with whom relations are forbidden, it is written here: “Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there, “For all these abominations
Ulla says: as if he built altar as it is stated: “Cease you from man, in whose nostrils there is breath, for how little [ bammeh ] is he to be accounted” Do not read as bammeh , Rather, bama ,

What “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished” Rav says: Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even he attributed possession of heaven and earth to the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as Abraham our forefather that it is written with regard to him: “I have lifted up my hand to the Lord, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth” he will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
poses a difficulty to the school of Rabbi Sheila: This “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished,” It should have My hand,

Rather, of the school of Rabbi Sheila say: even received the Torah like Moses our teacher that it is written with regard to him: “At His right hand was a fiery law unto them” will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
This poses a difficulty to Rabbi Yoḥanan: This hand to hand” It should have Hand from hand,
Rather Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: With wheat or with barley? With soft bread or with hard bread? Let it stand.
אָמַר Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef אָמַר Rabbi Yoḥanan: Each and each—by himself he estimated. And behold there is Ben Azzai who did not marry?
If you wish, say: he had taken and had explained. And if you wish, say: from his master he heard it. And if you wish, say: “The secret of Hashem is to those who fear Him.”

Darash Rav Avira, sometimes he said it in the name of Rabbi Ammi, and sometimes he said it in the name of Rabbi Assi: Anyone who eats bread without netilat yadayim — it is as if he came upon a woman, a zonah. As it is said: “For on account of a woman, a zonah, one is brought to a loaf of bread.”

אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: this “For on account of a harlot woman unto a loaf of bread” — “For on account of a loaf of bread unto a harlot woman” it should have said! Rather, Rava said: anyone who comes upon a harlot woman, in the end seeks a loaf of bread.

Amar Rabbi Zerika amar Rabbi Elazar: Anyone who treats lightly netilat yadayim is uprooted from the world. Amar Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi amar Rav: Mayim rishonim—he needs that he raise his hands upward; mayim aḥaronim—he needs that he lower his hands downward. Tanya namei hakhi: One who washes his hands—he needs that he raise his hands upward, lest the water go out beyond the joint, and return and render the hands impure.

אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: Rabbi Abbahu said: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — anyone who eats bread without wiping of the hands — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, it is as if he eats impure bread, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: as it is said: “וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳”. “And Hashem said: Thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread impure, etc.”

And what is: “And a man’s wife hunts a precious soul”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any man in whom there is haughtiness of spirit — in the end he stumbles with a man’s wife, as it is said: “And a man’s wife hunts a precious soul.”

אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — this “a precious soul” — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. “a lofty soul” it is required for it. וְעוֹד: and furthermore: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! “she will hunt” it is required for it! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: rather, Rava said: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, anyone who comes upon a married woman, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה even if he learned Torah דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ for it is written about it: ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, “She is more precious than pearls,” מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל than a Kohen Gadol שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, who enters within and within, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — “she will hunt him” — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם. to the judgment of Gehinnam.

אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shim‘on ben Yoḥai: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. any person in whom there is haughtiness of spirit — it is as if he serves idolatry. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, and it is written here: “An abomination of the LORD is every one that is proud in heart,” וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״. and it is written there: “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house.”
And Rabbi Yoḥanan, his own, said: as if he denied the root-principle, as it is said: “And your heart will be lifted up, and you will forget the LORD your God, etc.”

Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: As though he came upon all the forbidden sexual relations. It is written here: “An abomination of the LORD is every one that is proud in heart,” and it is written there: “For all these abominations, etc.”
Ulla said: As though he built a *bamah*, as it is said: “Cease for yourselves from man, whose breath is in his nostrils, for in what is he accounted?” — do not read “*bammeh*,” but rather “*bamah*.”

What is “hand to hand he shall not be cleansed”? Rav said: Anyone who comes upon a married woman, even if he acquired for the Holy One, blessed be He, heaven and earth like Avraham our father, as it is written about him: “I have lifted up my hand to the LORD, God Most High, Possessor of heaven and earth” — he shall not be cleansed from the judgment of Gehinnom.
It was difficult for them, for the house of Rabbi Sheila: this “Hand to hand he shall not be cleansed,” “my hand” it is required for it!

Rather, they said of the house of Rabbi Sheila: Even if he received Torah like Moshe Rabbenu, as it is written about it, “From His right hand, a fiery law for them” — he will not be cleared from the judgment of Gehinnam.
It was difficult for Rabbi Yoḥanan: this “hand to hand,” “hand from hand” it should have said!
Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said:

sentences.text: בִּדְחִטֵּי אוֹ בְּדִשְׂעָרֵי? בְּרַכִּיכָא אוֹ בַּאֲקוֹשָׁא? תֵּיקוּ.
sentences.human_translation: where of wheat, or where of barley, where soft, or where hard, shall stand
sentences.llm_translation: With wheat or with barley? With soft bread or with hard bread? Let it stand.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד — בְּעַצְמוֹ שִׁיעֵר. וְהָאִיכָּא בֶּן עַזַּאי דְּלָא נְסֵיב?
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Each and every one estimated based on himself, But there is ben Azzai, who did not marry,
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר Rav Yitzḥak bar Rav Yosef אָמַר Rabbi Yoḥanan: Each and each—by himself he estimated. And behold there is Ben Azzai who did not marry?

sentences.text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: נְסֵיב וּפֵירַשׁ הֲוָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: If you wish, say he was married and separated And if you wish, say he heard from his teacher. And if you wish, say “The counsel of the Lord is with them that fear Him”
sentences.llm_translation: If you wish, say: he had taken and had explained. And if you wish, say: from his master he heard it. And if you wish, say: “The secret of Hashem is to those who fear Him.”

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב עַוִּירָא, זִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, וְזִמְנִין אָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל לֶחֶם בְּלֹא נְטִילַת יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Avira interpreted homiletically; times he said in the name of Rabbi Ami and times he said it in the name of Rabbi Asi: anyone who eats bread without washing hands, as if engaged in sexual intercourse with a prostitute, as it is stated: “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread.”
sentences.llm_translation: Darash Rav Avira, sometimes he said it in the name of Rabbi Ammi, and sometimes he said it in the name of Rabbi Assi: Anyone who eats bread without netilat yadayim — it is as if he came upon a woman, a zonah. As it is said: “For on account of a woman, a zonah, one is brought to a loaf of bread.”

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״בְּעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״ — ״בְּעַד כִּכַּר לֶחֶם עַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה, לְסוֹף מְבַקֵּשׁ כִּכַּר לֶחֶם.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: This “For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread,” It should have “On account of a loaf a man is brought to a harlot.” Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with a harlot eventually beg a loaf of bread.
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: this “For on account of a harlot woman unto a loaf of bread” — “For on account of a loaf of bread unto a harlot woman” it should have said! Rather, Rava said: anyone who comes upon a harlot woman, in the end seeks a loaf of bread.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְּזַלְזֵל בִּנְטִילַת יָדַיִם נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מַיִם רִאשׁוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, מַיִם אַחֲרוֹנִים — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּשְׁפִּיל יָדָיו לְמַטָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁמָּא יֵצְאוּ הַמַּיִם חוּץ לַפֶּרֶק, וְיַחְזְרוּ וִיטַמְּאוּ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who treats washing hands with contempt is uprooted from the world. Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: first water, must raise his hands upward last water, must lower his hands downward. This is also taught One who washes his hands must raise his hands upward lest the water advance past the joint and return rendering hands ritually impure.
sentences.llm_translation: Amar Rabbi Zerika amar Rabbi Elazar: Anyone who treats lightly netilat yadayim is uprooted from the world. Amar Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi amar Rav: Mayim rishonim—he needs that he raise his hands upward; mayim aḥaronim—he needs that he lower his hands downward. Tanya namei hakhi: One who washes his hands—he needs that he raise his hands upward, lest the water go out beyond the joint, and return and render the hands impure.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Anyone who eats bread without wiping hands as if he were eating impure bread, as it is stated: “And the Lord said: Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread unclean
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: Rabbi Abbahu said: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל פַּת בְּלֹא נִיגּוּב יָדַיִם — anyone who eats bread without wiping of the hands — כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל לֶחֶם טָמֵא, it is as if he eats impure bread, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: as it is said: “וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ כָּכָה יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת לַחְמָם טָמֵא וְגוֹ׳”. “And Hashem said: Thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread impure, etc.”

sentences.text: וּמַאי ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — לְבַסּוֹף נִכְשָׁל בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה תָצוּד״.
sentences.human_translation: And what “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any person who has arrogance within him will eventually stumble with an adulteress, as it is stated: “But the adulteress hunts for the precious life,”
sentences.llm_translation: And what is: “And a man’s wife hunts a precious soul”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any man in whom there is haughtiness of spirit — in the end he stumbles with a man’s wife, as it is said: “And a man’s wife hunts a precious soul.”

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. וְעוֹד: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: This “The precious life,” It should have An arrogant life. And further, it should have she hunts Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even studied Torah, about which it is written: “She is more precious than rubies [ peninim ]” than a High Priest, who enters the innermost sanctum, this will entrap him into the judgment of Gehenna,
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: הַאי ״נֶפֶשׁ יְקָרָה״ — this “a precious soul” — ״נֶפֶשׁ גְּבוֹהָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. “a lofty soul” it is required for it. וְעוֹד: and furthermore: ״הִיא תָּצוּד״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! “she will hunt” it is required for it! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: rather, Rava said: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, anyone who comes upon a married woman, אֲפִילּוּ לָמַד תּוֹרָה even if he learned Torah דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ for it is written about it: ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, “She is more precious than pearls,” מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל than a Kohen Gadol שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, who enters within and within, ״הִיא תְּצוּדֶנּוּ״ — “she will hunt him” — לְדִינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם. to the judgment of Gehinnam.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Any person who has arrogance within him as if he were an idol worshipper, it is written here: “Everyone that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house”
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shim‘on ben Yoḥai: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. any person in whom there is haughtiness of spirit — it is as if he serves idolatry. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, and it is written here: “An abomination of the LORD is every one that is proud in heart,” וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְלָא תָבִיא תוֹעֵבָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״. and it is written there: “And you shall not bring an abomination into your house.”

sentences.text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ כָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרָם לְבָבֶךָ וְשָׁכַחְתָּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said his own as if he has denied the core as it is stated: “Then your heart be lifted up, and you forget the Lord your God”
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, his own, said: as if he denied the root-principle, as it is said: “And your heart will be lifted up, and you will forget the LORD your God, etc.”

sentences.text: רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּא עַל כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תּוֹעֲבַת ה׳ כׇּל גְּבַהּ לֵב״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״כִּי אֶת כׇּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: as if he engaged in sexual intercourse with all those with whom relations are forbidden, it is written here: “Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord” and it is written there, “For all these abominations
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: As though he came upon all the forbidden sexual relations. It is written here: “An abomination of the LORD is every one that is proud in heart,” and it is written there: “For all these abominations, etc.”

sentences.text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חִדְלוּ לָכֶם מִן הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר נְשָׁמָה בְּאַפּוֹ כִּי בַּמֶּה נֶחְשָׁב הוּא״ — אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בַּמֶּה״, אֶלָּא ״בָּמָה״.
sentences.human_translation: Ulla says: as if he built altar as it is stated: “Cease you from man, in whose nostrils there is breath, for how little [ bammeh ] is he to be accounted” Do not read as bammeh , Rather, bama ,
sentences.llm_translation: Ulla said: As though he built a *bamah*, as it is said: “Cease for yourselves from man, whose breath is in his nostrils, for in what is he accounted?” — do not read “*bammeh*,” but rather “*bamah*.”

sentences.text: מַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״? אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְנָהוּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״הֲרִימֹתִי יָדִי אֶל ה׳ אֵל עֶלְיוֹן קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: What “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished” Rav says: Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse with an adulteress, even he attributed possession of heaven and earth to the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as Abraham our forefather that it is written with regard to him: “I have lifted up my hand to the Lord, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth” he will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
sentences.llm_translation: What is “hand to hand he shall not be cleansed”? Rav said: Anyone who comes upon a married woman, even if he acquired for the Holy One, blessed be He, heaven and earth like Avraham our father, as it is written about him: “I have lifted up my hand to the LORD, God Most High, Possessor of heaven and earth” — he shall not be cleansed from the judgment of Gehinnom.

sentences.text: קַשְׁיָא לְהוּ לִדְבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד לֹא יִנָּקֶה״, ״יָדִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
sentences.human_translation: poses a difficulty to the school of Rabbi Sheila: This “Hand to hand, he shall not be unpunished,” It should have My hand,
sentences.llm_translation: It was difficult for them, for the house of Rabbi Sheila: this “Hand to hand he shall not be cleansed,” “my hand” it is required for it!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: אֲפִילּוּ קִיבֵּל תּוֹרָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״ — לֹא יִנָּקֶה מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, of the school of Rabbi Sheila say: even received the Torah like Moses our teacher that it is written with regard to him: “At His right hand was a fiery law unto them” will not be unpunished from the judgment of Gehenna.
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, they said of the house of Rabbi Sheila: Even if he received Torah like Moshe Rabbenu, as it is written about it, “From His right hand, a fiery law for them” — he will not be cleared from the judgment of Gehinnam.

sentences.text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַאי ״יָד לְיָד״, ״יָד מִיָּד״ מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!
sentences.human_translation: This poses a difficulty to Rabbi Yoḥanan: This hand to hand” It should have Hand from hand,
sentences.llm_translation: It was difficult for Rabbi Yoḥanan: this “hand to hand,” “hand from hand” it should have said!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
sentences.human_translation: Rather Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said:

text: יֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם!
לָא שְׁכִיחָא.

מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד עוֹשֶׂה לָהּ? מוֹלִיכָהּ לְבֵית דִּין שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם, וּמוֹסְרִין לוֹ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּעְלָהּ נֶאֱמָן עָלֶיהָ.

גְּמָ׳ תְּרֵי וְאִיהוּ — הָא תְּלָתָא. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בָּעִיר, אֲבָל בַּדֶּרֶךְ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה, שֶׁמָּא יִצְטָרֵךְ אֶחָד מֵהֶן לִנְקָבָיו, וְנִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן מִתְיַיחֵד עִם הָעֶרְוָה.
לָא: הָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיהְווֹ עֲלֵיהּ סָהֲדִי.

תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — אִין, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא — לָא. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְאִידַּךְ דְּרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא כְּשֵׁרִין, אֲבָל פְּרוּצִין, אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה נָמֵי לָא. מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וְהוֹצִיאוּהָ עֲשָׂרָה בְּמִטָּה.
לָא, הָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — דְּיָדְעִי לְאַתְרוֹיֵי בֵּיהּ.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּעְלָהּ וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, בַּעְלָהּ נֶאֱמָן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה נִדָּה שֶׁהִיא בְּכָרֵת — בַּעְלָהּ נֶאֱמָן עָלֶיהָ, סוֹטָה שֶׁהִיא בְּלָאו — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
וְרַבָּנַן, הִיא הַנּוֹתֶנֶת: נִדָּה דְּכָרֵת — חֲמִירָא לֵיהּ וּמְהֵימַן. סוֹטָה דְּלָאו — לָא חֲמִירָא לֵיהּ, וְלָא מְהֵימַן.

וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ? וְהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִקְּרָאֵי מַיְיתֵי לַהּ! דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהֵבִיא הָאִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן״. מִן הַתּוֹרָה הָאִישׁ מֵבִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: מוֹסְרִין לוֹ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, בַּעְלָהּ נֶאֱמָן עָלֶיהָ מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה נִדָּה שֶׁהִיא בְּכָרֵת — בַּעְלָהּ נֶאֱמָן עָלֶיהָ, סוֹטָה שֶׁהִיא בְּלָאו — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּנִדָּה — שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר, תֹּאמַר בְּסוֹטָה — שֶׁאֵין לָהּ הֶיתֵּר, וְאוֹמֵר: ״מַיִם גְּנוּבִים יִמְתָּקוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַתּוֹרָה הָאִישׁ מֵבִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהֵבִיא הָאִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״!
אֲמַר לְהוּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּרֵישָׁא וּפַרְכוּהּ, וַהֲדַר אָמַר לְהוּ קְרָא.
רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ ״אֲבָל אָמְרוּ״.
מַתְנִי׳ הָיוּ מַעֲלִין אוֹתָהּ לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וּמְאַיְּימִין עָלֶיהָ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּאַיְּימִין עַל עֵדֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
וְאוֹמֵר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, הַרְבֵּה יַיִן עוֹשֶׂה, הַרְבֵּה שְׂחוֹק עוֹשֶׂה, הַרְבֵּה יַלְדוּת עוֹשָׂה, הַרְבֵּה שְׁכֵנִים הָרָעִים עוֹשִׂין.
עֲשִׂי לִשְׁמוֹ הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְתַּב בִּקְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא יִמָּחֶה עַל הַמַּיִם. וְאוֹמֵר לְפָנֶיהָ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵינָם כְּדַי לְשׁוֹמְעָן, הִיא וְכׇל מִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
אִם אָמְרָה ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי״ — שׁוֹבֶרֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וְיוֹצֵאת.
וְאִם אָמְרָה ״טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ — מַעֲלִין אוֹתָהּ לְשַׁעַר הַמִּזְרָח שֶׁעַל פֶּתַח שַׁעַר נִקָּנוֹר, שֶׁשָּׁם מַשְׁקִין אֶת הַסּוֹטוֹת, וּמְטַהֲרִין אֶת הַיּוֹלְדוֹת, וּמְטַהֲרִין אֶת הַמְצוֹרָעִין.

וְכֹהֵן אוֹחֵז בִּבְגָדֶיהָ. אִם נִקְרְעוּ — נִקְרְעוּ. וְאִם נִפְרְמוּ — נִפְרְמוּ. עַד שֶׁהוּא מְגַלֶּה אֶת לִבָּהּ. וְסוֹתֵר אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה לִבָּהּ נָאֶה — לֹא הָיָה מְגַלֵּהוּ, וְאִם הָיָה שְׂעָרָהּ נָאֶה — לֹא הָיָה סוֹתֵר.
הָיְתָה מִתְכַּסָּה בִּלְבָנִים — מְכַסֶּהָ בִּשְׁחוֹרִים. הָיָה עָלֶיהָ כְּלֵי זָהָב
וְקַטְלֵיאוֹת, נְזָמִים וְטַבָּעוֹת — מַעֲבִירִין מִמֶּנָּה, כְּדֵי לְנַוְּולָהּ. וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵבִיא חֶבֶל מִצְרִי וְקוֹשְׁרוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִדַּדֶּיהָ,

וְכׇל הָרוֹצֶה לִרְאוֹת בָּא לִרְאוֹת, חוּץ מֵעֲבָדֶיהָ וְשִׁפְחוֹתֶיהָ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבָּהּ גַּס בָּהֶן. וְכׇל הַנָּשִׁים מוּתָּרוֹת לִרְאוֹתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִוַּסְּרוּ כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂינָה כְּזִמַּתְכֶנָה״.

גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אָתְיָא ״תּוֹרָה״ ״תּוֹרָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ הַכֹּהֵן אֵת כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּשִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד — אַף כָּאן בְּשִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.

וּמְאַיְּימִין עָלֶיהָ וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּאַיְּימִין עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה כָּךְ מְאַיְּימִין עָלֶיהָ שֶׁתִּשְׁתֶּה. אוֹמְרִים לָהּ: בִּתִּי, אִם בָּרוּר לָךְ הַדָּבָר שֶׁטְּהוֹרָה אַתְּ עִמְדִי עַל בּוּרְיִיךְ, וּשְׁתִי. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַיִם הַמָּרִים דּוֹמִין אֶלָּא לְסַם יָבֵשׁ שֶׁמּוּנָּח עַל בָּשָׂר חַי. אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מַכָּה — מְחַלְחֵל וְיוֹרֵד, אֵין שָׁם מַכָּה — אֵינוֹ מוֹעִיל כְּלוּם.
לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה. כָּאן — לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְחֲקָה מְגִילָּה.

וְאוֹמֵר לְפָנֶיהָ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אוֹמֵר לְפָנֶיהָ דְּבָרִים שֶׁל הַגָּדָה, וּמַעֲשִׂים שֶׁאֵירְעוּ בִּכְתוּבִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, כְּגוֹן: ״אֲשֶׁר חֲכָמִים יַגִּידוּ וְלֹא כִחֲדוּ מֵאֲבוֹתָם״.

יְהוּדָה הוֹדָה וְלֹא בּוֹשׁ, מֶה הָיָה סוֹפוֹ — נָחַל חַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. רְאוּבֵן הוֹדָה וְלֹא בּוֹשׁ, מֶה הָיָה סוֹפוֹ — נָחַל חַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וּמָה שְׂכָרָן? מָה שְׂכָרָן?! כִּדְקָא אָמְרִינַן! אֶלָּא: מָה שְׂכָרָן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״לָהֶם לְבַדָּם נִתְּנָה הָאָרֶץ וְלֹא עָבַר זָר בְּתוֹכָם״.
בִּשְׁלָמָא בִּיהוּדָה אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּאוֹדִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, אֶלָּא רְאוּבֵן מְנָלַן דְּאוֹדִי?
דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״יְחִי רְאוּבֵן וְאַל יָמֹת״, ״וְזֹאת לִיהוּדָה״?

כׇּל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ עַצְמוֹתָיו שֶׁל יְהוּדָה מְגוּלְגָּלִין בָּאָרוֹן, עַד שֶׁעָמַד מֹשֶׁה וּבִקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי גָּרַם לִרְאוּבֵן שֶׁהוֹדָה — יְהוּדָה: ״וְזֹאת לִיהוּדָה״?!

מִיָּד: ״שְׁמַע ה׳ קוֹל יְהוּדָה״, עָל אֵיבְרֵיהּ לְשָׁפָא. וְלָא הֲוָה קָא מְעַיְּילִין לֵיהּ לִמְתִיבְתָּא דִרְקִיעָא, ״וְאֶל עַמּוֹ תְּבִיאֶנּוּ״. וְלָא הֲוָה קָא יָדַע מִשְׁקַל וּמִטְרַח בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי רַבָּנַן, ״יָדָיו רָב לוֹ״. לָא הֲוָה קָא סָלְקָא לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְהִילְכְתָא, ״וְעֵזֶר מִצָּרָיו תִּהְיֶה״.

בִּשְׁלָמָא יְהוּדָה דְּאוֹדִי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֹא תִּישָּׂרֵף תָּמָר. אֶלָּא רְאוּבֵן, לְמָה לֵיהּ דְּאוֹדִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: חֲצִיף עֲלַי דִּמְפָרֵיט חֶטְאֵיהּ? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיחַשְׁדוּ אֲחוֹהִי.
אִם אָמְרָה ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי״ וְכוּ׳. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ כּוֹתְבִין שׁוֹבָר.
אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תְּנִי: ״מְקָרַעַת״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא ״שׁוֹבֶרֶת״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן.
וְאִם אָמְרָה ״טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי״ מַעֲלִין אוֹתָהּ לְשַׁעֲרֵי מִזְרָח. מַעֲלִין אוֹתָהּ?!
