תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹטָה נָתְנָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהּ, מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשָׁה — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהּ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָהּ — נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — מַה שֶּׁמְבַקֵּשׁ אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ — נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ.

וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּנָחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי, שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לוֹ — מַה שֶּׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְעַכְשָׁיו ״אָרוּר הוּא מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״.

אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עַל גְּחוֹנוֹ יֵלֵךְ״. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מַאֲכָלוֹ מַאֲכַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עָפָר יֹאכַל״. הוּא אָמַר אֶהֱרוֹג אֶת אָדָם וְאֶשָּׂא אֶת חַוָּה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״אֵיבָה אָשִׁית בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ וּבֵין זַרְעָהּ״.

וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן וְקֹרַח וּבִלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם וַאֲדוֹנִיָּהוּ וְעוּזִּיָּהוּ וְהָמָן — שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהֶם. מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשׁוּ — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהֶם, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָם — נְטָלוּהוּ מֵהֶם.

בַּיָּרֵךְ הִתְחִילָּה בַּעֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּתֵת ה׳ אֶת יְרֵכֵךְ נוֹפֶלֶת וְאֶת בִּטְנֵךְ צָבָה״ — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצָבְתָה בִטְנָהּ וְנָפְלָה יְרֵכָהּ״?

אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי לָיֵיט — לָיֵיט תְּחִילָּה יָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר בֶּטֶן לָיֵיט, וּמַיָּא כִּי בָּדְקִי — כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בָּדְקִי, בֶּטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ. בִּקְלָלָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״! הָהוּא דְּמוֹדַע לַהּ כֹּהֵן דְּבֶטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל מַיִם הַמָּרִים.
מַתְנִי׳ שִׁמְשׁוֹן הָלַךְ אַחַר עֵינָיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וּלְפִי שֶׁבָּא עַל עֶשֶׂר פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְּנוּ בּוֹ עֶשֶׂר לוֹנְבִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים נוֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב״. וּלְפִי שֶׁגָּנַב שָׁלֹשׁ גְּנֵבוֹת: לֵב אָבִיו, וְלֵב בֵּית דִּין, וְלֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְגַנֵּב אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת לֵב אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְקְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם״.

וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוֹבָה: מִרְיָם הִמְתִּינָה לְמֹשֶׁה שָׁעָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְעַכְּבוּ לָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם לֹא נָסַע עַד הֵאָסֵף מִרְיָם״.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו, וְאֵין בְּאֶחָיו גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבֹּר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ עִמּוֹ גַּם רֶכֶב גַּם פָּרָשִׁים״. מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה.

מֹשֶׁה זָכָה בְּעַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף, וְאֵין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״. לֹא עַל מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא עַל כׇּל הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ כְּבוֹד ה׳ יַאַסְפֶךָ״.

גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּעֵינָיו מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. כִּי אֲזַל מִיהָא — בָּתַר יַשְׁרוּתֵיהּ אֲזַל.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה. תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַזָּתָה וַיַּרְא שָׁם אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרִידוּ אוֹתוֹ עַזָּתָהּ״.
וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״? תְּחִלַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ מִיהָא בְּעַזָּה הֲוָה.

״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי כֵן וַיֶּאֱהַב אִשָּׁה בְּנַחַל שֹׂרֵק וּשְׁמָהּ דְּלִילָה״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״דְּלִילָה״ — רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה שֶׁתִּקָּרֵא דְּלִילָה: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.

דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּאִיסְתַּלַּק שְׁכִינָה מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע כִּי ה׳ סָר מֵעָלָיו״.

״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: נִיכָּרִין דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָדְעָה בּוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק דְּלָא מַפֵּיק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר ״נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר.
״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵצִיקָה לּוֹ בִדְבָרֶיהָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״. מַאי ״וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר בִּיאָה נִשְׁמְטָה מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמְרִי נָא וְאַל תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר וְאַל תֹּאכְלִי כׇּל טָמֵא״. מַאי ״כׇּל טָמֵא״? וְתוּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא דְּבָרִים טְמֵאִים קָאָכְלָה?! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִים בְּנָזִיר.
״וַיִּבְקַע אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַמַּכְתֵּשׁ אֲשֶׁר בַּלֶּחִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוּא אִיוָּה לְדָבָר טָמֵא — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלוּ חַיָּיו בְּדָבָר טָמֵא.
״וַתָּחֵל רוּחַ ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חָלְתָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי דָן נָחָשׁ עֲלֵי דֶרֶךְ״.

״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה מְקַשְׁקֶשֶׁת לְפָנָיו כְּזוֹג. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״פַּעֲמֹן וְרִמֹּן״.
״בֵּין צׇרְעָה וּבֵין אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צׇרְעָה וְאֶשְׁתָּאוֹל שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים הָיוּ, וַעֲקָרָן שִׁמְשׁוֹן וּטְחָנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
״וְהוּא יָחֵל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
human_translation: her face becomes sallow she painted her eyes for therefore her eyes bulge she braided her hair for therefore a priest unbraids her hair she indicated to with a finger therefore her fingernails fall off; she girded herself for with a ribbon therefore a priest brings an Egyptian rope and ties for her above her breasts; she extended her thigh for therefore her thigh falls away

She received upon her stomach, therefore her stomach swells; she fed him delicacies of the world, therefore her offering animal food, she gave him fine wine to drink in fine cups, therefore a priest gives her bitter water in an earthenware mekeida , to drink.
She acted in secret; “Who dwell in secret, with the Most High” turns face to her, as it is stated: “The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying: No eye shall see me;
Alternatively, she acted in secret, the Omnipresent revealed it in the open, as it is stated: “Though his hatred be concealed with deceit, his wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation”
And since Rabbi derives from: adding one thing to another, to find out the account” why do I “For every boot stamped with fierceness” to by the measure,
And since he derives it from “for every boot stamped with fierceness,” why do I “in full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”

to as by Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa, for Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a nation until its time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away,

Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: Why three cups that are stated with regard to Egypt One that it drank in the days of Moses one that it drank in the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that it will drink in the future with its companions,

And if you would say those have gone, and these are different ones, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, a second- to second- Egyptian in order that my son’s son will be permitted to enter into the congregation.

Rather, if was stated was stated like this: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish king until his time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”

Ameimar teaches that of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa with regard to this: What is which is written: “For I the Lord change not; and you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed” “For I the Lord change [ shaniti ] not” I did not strike a nation and repeat [ shaniti ] it, “And you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed,” This is as that which is written: I will consume My arrows upon them” My arrows are consumed and they, are not consumed
Rav Hamnuna says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a person until his se’a , is filled, as it is stated: “In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits;

Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, praise is comely for the upright [ nava tehilla ]” Do not read Praise is comely [ nava ]; rather, A house [ naveh ] of praise. This Moses and David, whose enemies did not rule over their achievements,

David, as it is written: “Her gates are sunk into the ground” Moses, as the Master said: When the first Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was sequestered, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where Rav Ḥisda says Avimi says: Beneath the tunnels of the Sanctuary.

The Sages taught sota placed her eyes, on one who is unfit for her, That which she desired, is not given to her, And that which she had, was taken away from her, that anyone who places his eyes on that which is not his is not given what he desires, and that which he had is taken from him.

And, so too, we found with regard to the primeval snake for he placed his eyes on that which was unfit for him, that which he desired was not given to him, and that which was in his possession was taken from him. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said will be king over every domesticated animal and non-domesticated animal, but now he is cursed more than all the domesticated animals and all the non-domesticated animals of the field,

I said will walk upright, now he shall go on his belly; I said his food will be food a person, now he shall eat dust. said: I will kill Adam and marry Eve, now: “I will put enmity between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed”

And so we found with regard to Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman, who placed their eyes on that which is unfit for them, and what they desired was not given to them, and what they had was taken from them.

She began her transgression with thigh From where are these matters If we say because it is written when the Lord does make your thigh to fall away, and your belly to swell” but isn’t written “And her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall fall away”

Abaye said When curses he first curses the thigh and then he curses the stomach, but when the water evaluates it evaluates along its way first stomach and then thigh. in curse it is also written: and will cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” That that the priest notifies her that stomach first and then thigh, so that not cast aspersions on the bitter water.
Samson followed his eyes, therefore the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”

Absalom was proud of his hair, therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he engaged in sexual intercourse with ten of his father’s concubines therefore ten spears [ loneviyyot ] were put, into him, as it is stated: “And ten young men that bore Joab’s armor compassed about And because he stole three thefts The heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of the Jewish people, as it is stated: “So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel” therefore three spears were embedded into as it is stated: And he took three spears in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom,

And the same with regard to the good Miriam waited for Moses one hour as it is stated: “And his sister stood afar off, Therefore the Jewish people delayed seven days for her as it is stated: and the people journeyed not until Miriam was brought in again”

Joseph merited to bury his father, and there was none among his brothers greater than he as it is stated: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen; Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, as it was none Moses who involved his

Moses merited in Joseph’s bones and there was none among the Jewish people greater than he, as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” Who a greater than Moses, as no one involved himself in his other than the Omnipresent as it is stated: “And He buried him in the valley Not only with regard to Moses did say but with regard to all the righteous individuals, as it is stated: “Your righteousness shall go before you and the glory of the Lord shall gather you in”

The Sages taught Samson rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: And Samson said to his father: Get her for me; for she is pleasant in my eyes” Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
Is that so? But isn’t it written: “But his father and his mother knew not that it was from the Lord; in any event when he went, he followed his inclination

It is taught Rabbi says: His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, therefore he was smitten in Gaza. His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, as it is written: “And Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, Therefore, he was smitten in Gaza, as it is written: and they brought him down to Gaza,
But isn’t it written “And Samson went down to Timnah, Gemara answers: In any event, his initial wrongdoing was in Gaza,

“And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah” It is taught Rabbi says: if she had not been called name Delilah, it would have been fitting that she be called Delilah, she weakened [ dildela ] his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds,

She weakened his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him” She weakened his heart, as it is written: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, She weakened his deeds, as the Divine Presence left him, as it is written: But he knew not that the Lord was departed from him”

“And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart” From where did she know Rabbi Ḥanin says Rav says: Words of truth are recognizable, Abaye says She knew about a righteous individual, that he would not express the name of Heaven in vain. Once he said: I have been a nazirite unto God she said: Now he is certainly saying the truth.

“And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, What “and urged him”? Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: At the moment completion of intercourse, she slipped away from beneath him.

“Now therefore beware, I pray of you, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing” what “any unclean thing”? And more, until now was she eating unclean things, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: items that are forbidden to a nazirite.
“But God cleaved the hollow place that is in Lehi, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: He desired something unclean, Therefore, his life was dependent on something unclean,
“And the spirit of the Lord began [ vataḥel ] Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The prophecy of Jacob our forefather took effect [ ḥaleta ] as it is written: “Dan shall be a serpent in the way,

“To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan.” Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: teaches that the Divine Presence jangled before him, like a bell [ zog ], it is written here: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan,” and it is written there “A bell [ pa’amon ] and a pomegranate”
“Between Zorah and Eshtaol.” Rabbi Asi says: Zorah and Eshtaol were two large mountains, and Samson uprooted them and ground them one against the other.
and he shall begin to save Israel Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says:
llm_translation: Her face becomes greenish. She painted for him her eyes — therefore her eyes protrude. She braided for him her hair — therefore the Kohen undoes her hair. She pointed for him with a finger — therefore her fingernails fall off. She girded for him with a belt — therefore the Kohen brings a rope of the Egyptian and ties for her above her breasts. She spread for him her thigh — therefore her thigh falls.

She received him upon her belly — therefore her belly swells. She fed him delicacies of the world — therefore her offering is food of an animal. She gave him to drink choice wine in choice cups — therefore a Kohen gives to drink the bitter waters in an earthenware jug.
She did it in secret — “He who sits in the secret of the Most High” set His face against her, as it is said: “And the eye of an adulterer watches for twilight, saying: No eye shall see me, etc.”.

Another matter: she did it in secret — HaMakom publicized her in the open, as it is said: “He that covereth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool. He that covereth hatred with a false show, his evil shall be revealed in the assembly (etc.).”
And since that it went out for him from “from one to one to find an account,” “For every boot booting with tumult” why to me? For the measure.
And since it went out for him from “For every boot booted with tumult”, “With se’ah, by sending her away, You contend with her” — for what do I need it?

In accordance with Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa. For Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the nation until the time of its sending away, as it is stated: “With measure, when You send it away, etc.”

Indeed? But did not Rava say: The three cups that are stated in Miṣrayim, why? One that she drank in the days of Moshe, and one that she drank in the days of Par‘oh Nekho, and one that she is destined to drink with her companions!

And if you will say: those have gone, and these are others — but is it not taught, Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin ger haMitzri was to me a friend from the disciples of Rabbi Akiva. Minyamin ger haMitzri said: I am a first-generation Egyptian, and I married a first-generation Egyptian woman; I will marry for my son a second-generation Egyptian woman, in order that my son’s son be permitted to come into the congregation!

Rather, if it was stated, thus it was stated: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact payment from the king until the hour of his sending away, as it is stated: “With measure, by her sending away, You contend with her, etc.”

Amemar would teach this of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa on this: What is that which is written: “For I, Hashem, I have not changed; and you, sons of Ya‘akov, have not been consumed”? “I, Hashem, I have not changed” — I did not strike a nation and repeat to it. “And you, sons of Ya‘akov, have not been consumed” — this is that which is written: “My arrows I will consume in them.” My arrows are consumed, and they are not consumed.
אָמַר Rav Hamnuna: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact payment from a man until his se’ah is filled, as it is said: “In the fullness of his sufficiency it shall be strait for him, etc.”

דָּרֵשׁ Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa: What is that which is written: “Sing, righteous ones, in HaShem; for the upright, praise is comely”? Do not read “comely is praise,” but rather “a dwelling of praise”; this is Moshe and David, that their enemies did not rule over their deeds.

David — as it is written: “Her gates have sunk into the earth.” Moshe — as the Master said: From when the First Mikdash was built, the Ohel Mo‘ed was hidden away, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where? Rav Ḥisda said, Avimi said: beneath the tunnels of the Heikhal.

**The Sages taught:** A *sotah* set her eyes upon one who was not fit for her; what she sought—was not given to her, and what was in her hand—they took it from her. For anyone who sets his eyes upon that which is not his—what he seeks they do not give him, and what is in his hand—they take from him.

And so we found with the Naḥash ha-Kadmoni, that he set his eyes on that which is not fit for him — what he sought they did not give him, and what was in his hand they took it from him. Said HaKadosh Barukh Hu: I said, let him be king over every behemah and ḥayyah, and now: “cursed is he more than every behemah and more than every ḥayyat ha-sadeh.”

I said: he shall walk with an upright stature; now — “upon your belly you shall go.” I said: his food shall be the food of man; now — “dust you shall eat.” He said: I will kill the man and I will marry Ḥavvah; now — “and enmity I will place between you and between the woman, and between your seed and between her seed.”

And so we found with Qayin and Qoraḥ and Bil‘am and Do’eg and Aḥitofel and Geḥazi and Avshalom and Adoniyahu and ‘Uzziyahu and Haman — that they set their eyes upon that which is not fitting for them. What they sought — was not given to them, and what was in their hand — they took it from them.

**IN THE THIGH it began with the transgression, etc.** From where are these words? If you will say, because it is written: “when HaShem gives your thigh falling and your belly swelling” — but is it not written: “and her belly shall swell and her thigh shall fall”?

Amar Abayei: when he curses — he curses first thigh, and afterward belly he curses; but the water when they examine — according to their way they examine, belly at the beginning and afterward thigh. In the curse also it is written: “to swell belly and to cause thigh to fall”! That is that the Kohen informs her that belly at the beginning and afterward thigh, so as not to bring out slander upon the bitter waters.
**Mishnah:** Shimshon went after his eyes — therefore the Pelishtim gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Pelishtim seized him and gouged out his eyes.”

Avshalom became haughty in his hair — therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he came upon ten pilagshim of his father — therefore ten lonbiyyot were given into him, as it is said: “And ten men, bearers of the vessels of Yoav, surrounded.” And because he stole three thefts: the heart of his father, and the heart of Beit Din, and the heart of Yisrael, as it is said: “And Avshalom stole the heart of the men of Yisrael” — therefore three shevatim were thrust into him, as it is said: “And he took three shevatim in his palm and thrust them into the heart of Avshalom.”

AND so too with regard to the good: Miryam waited for Moshe one hour, as it is stated: “And his sister stood from afar” — therefore Yisrael were delayed for her seven days in the wilderness, as it is stated: “And the people did not journey until Miryam was gathered in.”

Yosef merited to bury his father, and there is none among his brothers greater than he, as it is said: “And Yosef went up to bury his father, and there went up with him both chariots and horsemen.” Who is for us greater than Yosef, that none occupied himself with him except Moshe.

Moshe merited with the bones of Yosef, and there is in Yisrael none greater than him, as it is said: “And Moshe took the bones of Yosef with him” — who is greater than Moshe, that none occupied himself with him except HaMakom, as it is said: “And He buried him in the valley.” Not about Moshe alone did they say, but rather about all the righteous, as it is said: “And your righteousness shall go before you; the glory of Hashem shall gather you in.”

GEMARA: The Rabbis taught: Shimshon rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: “And Shimshon said to his father: Take her for me, for she is right in my eyes” — therefore the Pelishtim gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Pelishtim seized him and gouged out his eyes.”
Is that so? But is it not written: “And his father and his mother did not know that it was from HaShem”? When he went, in any case—he went after his uprightness.

It was taught, Rabbi says: The beginning of his corruption was in Azzah, therefore he was smitten in Azzah. The beginning of his corruption was in Azzah, as it is written: “And Shimshon went to Azzah, and he saw there a woman, a harlot, etc.” therefore he was smitten in Azzah, as it is written: “And they brought him down to Azzah.”
And is it not written: “And Shimshon went down to Timnata”? The beginning of his ruin, indeed, was in Azzah.

“‘And it was after this, and he loved a woman in Naḥal Sorek, and her name was Delilah.’” It is taught: Rabbi says: Were her name not called “Delilah” — she was fit that she be called Delilah: she diminished his strength, she diminished his heart, she diminished his deeds.

She weakened his strength — as it is written: “And his strength departed from upon him.” She weakened his heart — as it is written: “And Delilah saw that he told her all his heart.” She weakened his deeds — for the Shekhinah departed from him, as it is written: “And he did not know that Hashem had departed from upon him.”

“‘And Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart.’ From where did she know? Rabbi Ḥanin said, Rav said: words of truth are recognizable. Abaye said: she knew of him, of that righteous one, that he does not utter the Name of Heaven in vain. Since he said: ‘a Nazirite of God am I,’ she said: now, certainly, he is saying truth.”

“And it was, when she pressed him with her words all the days, and she compelled him.” What is “and she compelled him”? אמר Rabbi Yitzḥak d’vei Rabbi Ammi: at the time of the completion of intercourse she slipped away from under him.

“‘And now, be guarded, please, and do not drink wine and strong drink, and do not eat any unclean thing.’ What is ‘any unclean thing’? And further: until now, unclean things was she eating?! אמר רבי יצחק דבי רבי אמי: things that are forbidden with a Nazir.”
“‘And Elohim split the hollow that is in the Leḥi.’” Said Rabbi Yitzḥak of the house of Rabbi Ammi: He longed for a דבר טמא — therefore his life was hung upon a דבר טמא.
“‘And the spirit of the LORD began, etc.’” Amar Rabbi Ḥama be-Rabbi Ḥanina: The prophecy of Ya‘akov Avinu began, as it is written: “Let Dan be a serpent upon the way.”

“‘To stir him in the camp of Dan’”; Rabbi Yitzḥak of the house of Rabbi Ammi said: It teaches that the Shekhinah was jingling before him like a bell. It is written here: “To stir him in the camp of Dan,” and it is written there: “A bell and a pomegranate.”
“ ‘Between Tzor‘ah and between Eshta’ol,’ ” said Rabbi Assi: Tzor‘ah and Eshta’ol were two great mountains, and Shimshon uprooted them and ground them, this into this.
“‘And he shall begin to save Yisrael,’” said Rabbi Ḥama in Rabbi Ḥanina:

sentences.text: פָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת. הִיא כָּחֲלָה לוֹ עֵינֶיהָ — לְפִיכָךְ עֵינֶיהָ בּוֹלְטוֹת. הִיא קָלְעָה לוֹ אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן סוֹתֵר אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ. הִיא הֶרְאֲתָה לוֹ בְּאֶצְבַּע — לְפִיכָךְ צִיפּוֹרְנֶיהָ נוֹשְׁרוֹת. הִיא חָגְרָה לוֹ בְּצִילְצוֹל — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מֵבִיא חֶבֶל הַמִּצְרִי וְקוֹשֵׁר לָהּ לְמַעְלָה מִדַּדֶּיהָ. הִיא פָּשְׁטָה לוֹ אֶת יְרֵיכָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ יְרֵיכָהּ נוֹפֶלֶת.
sentences.human_translation: her face becomes sallow she painted her eyes for therefore her eyes bulge she braided her hair for therefore a priest unbraids her hair she indicated to with a finger therefore her fingernails fall off; she girded herself for with a ribbon therefore a priest brings an Egyptian rope and ties for her above her breasts; she extended her thigh for therefore her thigh falls away
sentences.llm_translation: Her face becomes greenish. She painted for him her eyes — therefore her eyes protrude. She braided for him her hair — therefore the Kohen undoes her hair. She pointed for him with a finger — therefore her fingernails fall off. She girded for him with a belt — therefore the Kohen brings a rope of the Egyptian and ties for her above her breasts. She spread for him her thigh — therefore her thigh falls.

sentences.text: הִיא קִיבְּלַתּוּ עַל כְּרֵיסָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ בִּטְנָהּ צָבָה. הִיא הֶאֱכִילַתּוּ מַעֲדַנֵּי עוֹלָם — לְפִיכָךְ קׇרְבָּנָהּ מַאֲכַל בְּהֵמָה. הִיא הִשְׁקַתְהוּ יַיִן מְשׁוּבָּח בְּכוֹסוֹת מְשׁוּבָּחִים — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מַשְׁקֶה מַיִם הַמָּרִים בִּמְקִידָּה שֶׁל חֶרֶשׂ.
sentences.human_translation: She received upon her stomach, therefore her stomach swells; she fed him delicacies of the world, therefore her offering animal food, she gave him fine wine to drink in fine cups, therefore a priest gives her bitter water in an earthenware mekeida , to drink.
sentences.llm_translation: She received him upon her belly — therefore her belly swells. She fed him delicacies of the world — therefore her offering is food of an animal. She gave him to drink choice wine in choice cups — therefore a Kohen gives to drink the bitter waters in an earthenware jug.

sentences.text: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — ״יוֹשֵׁב בְּסֵתֶר עֶלְיוֹן״ שָׂם בָּהּ פָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֵין נֹאֵף שָׁמְרָה נֶשֶׁף לֵאמֹר לֹא תְשׁוּרֵנִי עָיִן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: She acted in secret; “Who dwell in secret, with the Most High” turns face to her, as it is stated: “The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying: No eye shall see me;
sentences.llm_translation: She did it in secret — “He who sits in the secret of the Most High” set His face against her, as it is said: “And the eye of an adulterer watches for twilight, saying: No eye shall see me, etc.”.

sentences.text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — הַמָּקוֹם פִּירְסְמָה בַּגָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל (וְגוֹ׳)״.
sentences.human_translation: Alternatively, she acted in secret, the Omnipresent revealed it in the open, as it is stated: “Though his hatred be concealed with deceit, his wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation”
sentences.llm_translation: Another matter: she did it in secret — HaMakom publicized her in the open, as it is said: “He that covereth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool. He that covereth hatred with a false show, his evil shall be revealed in the assembly (etc.).”

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אַחַת לְאַחַת לִמְצֹא חֶשְׁבּוֹן״, ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכַמִּדָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And since Rabbi derives from: adding one thing to another, to find out the account” why do I “For every boot stamped with fierceness” to by the measure,
sentences.llm_translation: And since that it went out for him from “from one to one to find an account,” “For every boot booting with tumult” why to me? For the measure.

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״, ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה״ לְמָה לִי?
sentences.human_translation: And since he derives it from “for every boot stamped with fierceness,” why do I “in full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: And since it went out for him from “For every boot booted with tumult”, “With se’ah, by sending her away, You contend with her” — for what do I need it?

sentences.text: לְכִדְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאוּמָּה עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: to as by Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa, for Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a nation until its time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away,
sentences.llm_translation: In accordance with Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa. For Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact punishment from the nation until the time of its sending away, as it is stated: “With measure, when You send it away, etc.”

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ(ה) כּוֹסוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּמִצְרַיִם, לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה, וְאַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה, וְאַחַת שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִשְׁתּוֹת עִם חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ!
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: Why three cups that are stated with regard to Egypt One that it drank in the days of Moses one that it drank in the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that it will drink in the future with its companions,
sentences.llm_translation: Indeed? But did not Rava say: The three cups that are stated in Miṣrayim, why? One that she drank in the days of Moshe, and one that she drank in the days of Par‘oh Nekho, and one that she is destined to drink with her companions!

sentences.text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנָךְ אֲזַדוּ וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַשִּׂיא לִבְנֵי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי מוּתָּר לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל!
sentences.human_translation: And if you would say those have gone, and these are different ones, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, a second- to second- Egyptian in order that my son’s son will be permitted to enter into the congregation.
sentences.llm_translation: And if you will say: those have gone, and these are others — but is it not taught, Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin ger haMitzri was to me a friend from the disciples of Rabbi Akiva. Minyamin ger haMitzri said: I am a first-generation Egyptian, and I married a first-generation Egyptian woman; I will marry for my son a second-generation Egyptian woman, in order that my son’s son be permitted to come into the congregation!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הַמֶּלֶךְ עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, if was stated was stated like this: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish king until his time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, thus it was stated: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact payment from the king until the hour of his sending away, as it is stated: “With measure, by her sending away, You contend with her, etc.”

sentences.text: אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא אַהָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״? ״אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי״ — לֹא הִכֵּיתִי לְאוּמָּהּ וְשָׁנִיתִי לָהּ. ״וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״ — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״חִצַּי אֲכַלֶּה בָּם״. חִצַּי כָּלִין, וְהֵן אֵינָן כָּלִין.
sentences.human_translation: Ameimar teaches that of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa with regard to this: What is which is written: “For I the Lord change not; and you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed” “For I the Lord change [ shaniti ] not” I did not strike a nation and repeat [ shaniti ] it, “And you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed,” This is as that which is written: I will consume My arrows upon them” My arrows are consumed and they, are not consumed
sentences.llm_translation: Amemar would teach this of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa on this: What is that which is written: “For I, Hashem, I have not changed; and you, sons of Ya‘akov, have not been consumed”? “I, Hashem, I have not changed” — I did not strike a nation and repeat to it. “And you, sons of Ya‘akov, have not been consumed” — this is that which is written: “My arrows I will consume in them.” My arrows are consumed, and they are not consumed.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאָדָם עַד שֶׁתִּתְמַלֵּא סְאָתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּמְלֹאות שִׂפְקוֹ יֵצֶר לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a person until his se’a , is filled, as it is stated: “In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits;
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר Rav Hamnuna: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not exact payment from a man until his se’ah is filled, as it is said: “In the fullness of his sufficiency it shall be strait for him, etc.”

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים בַּה׳ לַיְשָׁרִים נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״? אַל תִּקְרֵי ״נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״, אֶלָּא ״נָוֶה תְהִלָּה״, זֶה מֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד, שֶׁלֹּא שָׁלְטוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, praise is comely for the upright [ nava tehilla ]” Do not read Praise is comely [ nava ]; rather, A house [ naveh ] of praise. This Moses and David, whose enemies did not rule over their achievements,
sentences.llm_translation: דָּרֵשׁ Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa: What is that which is written: “Sing, righteous ones, in HaShem; for the upright, praise is comely”? Do not read “comely is praise,” but rather “a dwelling of praise”; this is Moshe and David, that their enemies did not rule over their deeds.

sentences.text: דָּוִד — דִּכְתִיב: ״טָבְעוּ בָאָרֶץ שְׁעָרֶיהָ״. מֹשֶׁה — דְּאָמַר מָר: מִשֶּׁנִּבְנָה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן נִגְנַז אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, קְרָשָׁיו קְרָסָיו וּבְרִיחָיו וְעַמּוּדָיו וַאֲדָנָיו. הֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: תַּחַת מְחִילּוֹת שֶׁל הֵיכָל.
sentences.human_translation: David, as it is written: “Her gates are sunk into the ground” Moses, as the Master said: When the first Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was sequestered, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where Rav Ḥisda says Avimi says: Beneath the tunnels of the Sanctuary.
sentences.llm_translation: David — as it is written: “Her gates have sunk into the earth.” Moshe — as the Master said: From when the First Mikdash was built, the Ohel Mo‘ed was hidden away, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where? Rav Ḥisda said, Avimi said: beneath the tunnels of the Heikhal.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹטָה נָתְנָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהּ, מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשָׁה — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהּ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָהּ — נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — מַה שֶּׁמְבַקֵּשׁ אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ — נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught sota placed her eyes, on one who is unfit for her, That which she desired, is not given to her, And that which she had, was taken away from her, that anyone who places his eyes on that which is not his is not given what he desires, and that which he had is taken from him.
sentences.llm_translation: **The Sages taught:** A *sotah* set her eyes upon one who was not fit for her; what she sought—was not given to her, and what was in her hand—they took it from her. For anyone who sets his eyes upon that which is not his—what he seeks they do not give him, and what is in his hand—they take from him.

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּנָחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי, שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לוֹ — מַה שֶּׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְעַכְשָׁיו ״אָרוּר הוּא מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״.
sentences.human_translation: And, so too, we found with regard to the primeval snake for he placed his eyes on that which was unfit for him, that which he desired was not given to him, and that which was in his possession was taken from him. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said will be king over every domesticated animal and non-domesticated animal, but now he is cursed more than all the domesticated animals and all the non-domesticated animals of the field,
sentences.llm_translation: And so we found with the Naḥash ha-Kadmoni, that he set his eyes on that which is not fit for him — what he sought they did not give him, and what was in his hand they took it from him. Said HaKadosh Barukh Hu: I said, let him be king over every behemah and ḥayyah, and now: “cursed is he more than every behemah and more than every ḥayyat ha-sadeh.”

sentences.text: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עַל גְּחוֹנוֹ יֵלֵךְ״. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מַאֲכָלוֹ מַאֲכַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עָפָר יֹאכַל״. הוּא אָמַר אֶהֱרוֹג אֶת אָדָם וְאֶשָּׂא אֶת חַוָּה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״אֵיבָה אָשִׁית בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ וּבֵין זַרְעָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: I said will walk upright, now he shall go on his belly; I said his food will be food a person, now he shall eat dust. said: I will kill Adam and marry Eve, now: “I will put enmity between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed”
sentences.llm_translation: I said: he shall walk with an upright stature; now — “upon your belly you shall go.” I said: his food shall be the food of man; now — “dust you shall eat.” He said: I will kill the man and I will marry Ḥavvah; now — “and enmity I will place between you and between the woman, and between your seed and between her seed.”

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן וְקֹרַח וּבִלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם וַאֲדוֹנִיָּהוּ וְעוּזִּיָּהוּ וְהָמָן — שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהֶם. מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשׁוּ — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהֶם, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָם — נְטָלוּהוּ מֵהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And so we found with regard to Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman, who placed their eyes on that which is unfit for them, and what they desired was not given to them, and what they had was taken from them.
sentences.llm_translation: And so we found with Qayin and Qoraḥ and Bil‘am and Do’eg and Aḥitofel and Geḥazi and Avshalom and Adoniyahu and ‘Uzziyahu and Haman — that they set their eyes upon that which is not fitting for them. What they sought — was not given to them, and what was in their hand — they took it from them.

sentences.text: בַּיָּרֵךְ הִתְחִילָּה בַּעֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּתֵת ה׳ אֶת יְרֵכֵךְ נוֹפֶלֶת וְאֶת בִּטְנֵךְ צָבָה״ — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצָבְתָה בִטְנָהּ וְנָפְלָה יְרֵכָהּ״?
sentences.human_translation: She began her transgression with thigh From where are these matters If we say because it is written when the Lord does make your thigh to fall away, and your belly to swell” but isn’t written “And her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall fall away”
sentences.llm_translation: **IN THE THIGH it began with the transgression, etc.** From where are these words? If you will say, because it is written: “when HaShem gives your thigh falling and your belly swelling” — but is it not written: “and her belly shall swell and her thigh shall fall”?

sentences.text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי לָיֵיט — לָיֵיט תְּחִילָּה יָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר בֶּטֶן לָיֵיט, וּמַיָּא כִּי בָּדְקִי — כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בָּדְקִי, בֶּטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ. בִּקְלָלָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״! הָהוּא דְּמוֹדַע לַהּ כֹּהֵן דְּבֶטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל מַיִם הַמָּרִים.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye said When curses he first curses the thigh and then he curses the stomach, but when the water evaluates it evaluates along its way first stomach and then thigh. in curse it is also written: and will cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” That that the priest notifies her that stomach first and then thigh, so that not cast aspersions on the bitter water.
sentences.llm_translation: Amar Abayei: when he curses — he curses first thigh, and afterward belly he curses; but the water when they examine — according to their way they examine, belly at the beginning and afterward thigh. In the curse also it is written: “to swell belly and to cause thigh to fall”! That is that the Kohen informs her that belly at the beginning and afterward thigh, so as not to bring out slander upon the bitter waters.

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׁמְשׁוֹן הָלַךְ אַחַר עֵינָיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: Samson followed his eyes, therefore the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: **Mishnah:** Shimshon went after his eyes — therefore the Pelishtim gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Pelishtim seized him and gouged out his eyes.”

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וּלְפִי שֶׁבָּא עַל עֶשֶׂר פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְּנוּ בּוֹ עֶשֶׂר לוֹנְבִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים נוֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב״. וּלְפִי שֶׁגָּנַב שָׁלֹשׁ גְּנֵבוֹת: לֵב אָבִיו, וְלֵב בֵּית דִּין, וְלֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְגַנֵּב אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת לֵב אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְקְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם״.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he engaged in sexual intercourse with ten of his father’s concubines therefore ten spears [ loneviyyot ] were put, into him, as it is stated: “And ten young men that bore Joab’s armor compassed about And because he stole three thefts The heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of the Jewish people, as it is stated: “So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel” therefore three spears were embedded into as it is stated: And he took three spears in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom,
sentences.llm_translation: Avshalom became haughty in his hair — therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he came upon ten pilagshim of his father — therefore ten lonbiyyot were given into him, as it is said: “And ten men, bearers of the vessels of Yoav, surrounded.” And because he stole three thefts: the heart of his father, and the heart of Beit Din, and the heart of Yisrael, as it is said: “And Avshalom stole the heart of the men of Yisrael” — therefore three shevatim were thrust into him, as it is said: “And he took three shevatim in his palm and thrust them into the heart of Avshalom.”

sentences.text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוֹבָה: מִרְיָם הִמְתִּינָה לְמֹשֶׁה שָׁעָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְעַכְּבוּ לָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם לֹא נָסַע עַד הֵאָסֵף מִרְיָם״.
sentences.human_translation: And the same with regard to the good Miriam waited for Moses one hour as it is stated: “And his sister stood afar off, Therefore the Jewish people delayed seven days for her as it is stated: and the people journeyed not until Miriam was brought in again”
sentences.llm_translation: AND so too with regard to the good: Miryam waited for Moshe one hour, as it is stated: “And his sister stood from afar” — therefore Yisrael were delayed for her seven days in the wilderness, as it is stated: “And the people did not journey until Miryam was gathered in.”

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו, וְאֵין בְּאֶחָיו גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבֹּר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ עִמּוֹ גַּם רֶכֶב גַּם פָּרָשִׁים״. מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה.
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited to bury his father, and there was none among his brothers greater than he as it is stated: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen; Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, as it was none Moses who involved his
sentences.llm_translation: Yosef merited to bury his father, and there is none among his brothers greater than he, as it is said: “And Yosef went up to bury his father, and there went up with him both chariots and horsemen.” Who is for us greater than Yosef, that none occupied himself with him except Moshe.

sentences.text: מֹשֶׁה זָכָה בְּעַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף, וְאֵין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״. לֹא עַל מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא עַל כׇּל הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ כְּבוֹד ה׳ יַאַסְפֶךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Moses merited in Joseph’s bones and there was none among the Jewish people greater than he, as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” Who a greater than Moses, as no one involved himself in his other than the Omnipresent as it is stated: “And He buried him in the valley Not only with regard to Moses did say but with regard to all the righteous individuals, as it is stated: “Your righteousness shall go before you and the glory of the Lord shall gather you in”
sentences.llm_translation: Moshe merited with the bones of Yosef, and there is in Yisrael none greater than him, as it is said: “And Moshe took the bones of Yosef with him” — who is greater than Moshe, that none occupied himself with him except HaMakom, as it is said: “And He buried him in the valley.” Not about Moshe alone did they say, but rather about all the righteous, as it is said: “And your righteousness shall go before you; the glory of Hashem shall gather you in.”

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּעֵינָיו מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Samson rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: And Samson said to his father: Get her for me; for she is pleasant in my eyes” Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: GEMARA: The Rabbis taught: Shimshon rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: “And Shimshon said to his father: Take her for me, for she is right in my eyes” — therefore the Pelishtim gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Pelishtim seized him and gouged out his eyes.”

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. כִּי אֲזַל מִיהָא — בָּתַר יַשְׁרוּתֵיהּ אֲזַל.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it written: “But his father and his mother knew not that it was from the Lord; in any event when he went, he followed his inclination
sentences.llm_translation: Is that so? But is it not written: “And his father and his mother did not know that it was from HaShem”? When he went, in any case—he went after his uprightness.

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה. תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַזָּתָה וַיַּרְא שָׁם אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרִידוּ אוֹתוֹ עַזָּתָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, therefore he was smitten in Gaza. His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, as it is written: “And Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, Therefore, he was smitten in Gaza, as it is written: and they brought him down to Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught, Rabbi says: The beginning of his corruption was in Azzah, therefore he was smitten in Azzah. The beginning of his corruption was in Azzah, as it is written: “And Shimshon went to Azzah, and he saw there a woman, a harlot, etc.” therefore he was smitten in Azzah, as it is written: “And they brought him down to Azzah.”

sentences.text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״? תְּחִלַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ מִיהָא בְּעַזָּה הֲוָה.
sentences.human_translation: But isn’t it written “And Samson went down to Timnah, Gemara answers: In any event, his initial wrongdoing was in Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: And is it not written: “And Shimshon went down to Timnata”? The beginning of his ruin, indeed, was in Azzah.

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי כֵן וַיֶּאֱהַב אִשָּׁה בְּנַחַל שֹׂרֵק וּשְׁמָהּ דְּלִילָה״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״דְּלִילָה״ — רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה שֶׁתִּקָּרֵא דְּלִילָה: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah” It is taught Rabbi says: if she had not been called name Delilah, it would have been fitting that she be called Delilah, she weakened [ dildela ] his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds,
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And it was after this, and he loved a woman in Naḥal Sorek, and her name was Delilah.’” It is taught: Rabbi says: Were her name not called “Delilah” — she was fit that she be called Delilah: she diminished his strength, she diminished his heart, she diminished his deeds.

sentences.text: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּאִיסְתַּלַּק שְׁכִינָה מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע כִּי ה׳ סָר מֵעָלָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: She weakened his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him” She weakened his heart, as it is written: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, She weakened his deeds, as the Divine Presence left him, as it is written: But he knew not that the Lord was departed from him”
sentences.llm_translation: She weakened his strength — as it is written: “And his strength departed from upon him.” She weakened his heart — as it is written: “And Delilah saw that he told her all his heart.” She weakened his deeds — for the Shekhinah departed from him, as it is written: “And he did not know that Hashem had departed from upon him.”

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: נִיכָּרִין דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָדְעָה בּוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק דְּלָא מַפֵּיק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר ״נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart” From where did she know Rabbi Ḥanin says Rav says: Words of truth are recognizable, Abaye says She knew about a righteous individual, that he would not express the name of Heaven in vain. Once he said: I have been a nazirite unto God she said: Now he is certainly saying the truth.
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart.’ From where did she know? Rabbi Ḥanin said, Rav said: words of truth are recognizable. Abaye said: she knew of him, of that righteous one, that he does not utter the Name of Heaven in vain. Since he said: ‘a Nazirite of God am I,’ she said: now, certainly, he is saying truth.”

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵצִיקָה לּוֹ בִדְבָרֶיהָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״. מַאי ״וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר בִּיאָה נִשְׁמְטָה מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, What “and urged him”? Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: At the moment completion of intercourse, she slipped away from beneath him.
sentences.llm_translation: “And it was, when she pressed him with her words all the days, and she compelled him.” What is “and she compelled him”? אמר Rabbi Yitzḥak d’vei Rabbi Ammi: at the time of the completion of intercourse she slipped away from under him.

sentences.text: ״וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמְרִי נָא וְאַל תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר וְאַל תֹּאכְלִי כׇּל טָמֵא״. מַאי ״כׇּל טָמֵא״? וְתוּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא דְּבָרִים טְמֵאִים קָאָכְלָה?! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִים בְּנָזִיר.
sentences.human_translation: “Now therefore beware, I pray of you, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing” what “any unclean thing”? And more, until now was she eating unclean things, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: items that are forbidden to a nazirite.
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And now, be guarded, please, and do not drink wine and strong drink, and do not eat any unclean thing.’ What is ‘any unclean thing’? And further: until now, unclean things was she eating?! אמר רבי יצחק דבי רבי אמי: things that are forbidden with a Nazir.”

sentences.text: ״וַיִּבְקַע אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַמַּכְתֵּשׁ אֲשֶׁר בַּלֶּחִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוּא אִיוָּה לְדָבָר טָמֵא — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלוּ חַיָּיו בְּדָבָר טָמֵא.
sentences.human_translation: “But God cleaved the hollow place that is in Lehi, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: He desired something unclean, Therefore, his life was dependent on something unclean,
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And Elohim split the hollow that is in the Leḥi.’” Said Rabbi Yitzḥak of the house of Rabbi Ammi: He longed for a דבר טמא — therefore his life was hung upon a דבר טמא.

sentences.text: ״וַתָּחֵל רוּחַ ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חָלְתָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי דָן נָחָשׁ עֲלֵי דֶרֶךְ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And the spirit of the Lord began [ vataḥel ] Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The prophecy of Jacob our forefather took effect [ ḥaleta ] as it is written: “Dan shall be a serpent in the way,
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And the spirit of the LORD began, etc.’” Amar Rabbi Ḥama be-Rabbi Ḥanina: The prophecy of Ya‘akov Avinu began, as it is written: “Let Dan be a serpent upon the way.”

sentences.text: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה מְקַשְׁקֶשֶׁת לְפָנָיו כְּזוֹג. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״פַּעֲמֹן וְרִמֹּן״.
sentences.human_translation: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan.” Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: teaches that the Divine Presence jangled before him, like a bell [ zog ], it is written here: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan,” and it is written there “A bell [ pa’amon ] and a pomegranate”
sentences.llm_translation: “‘To stir him in the camp of Dan’”; Rabbi Yitzḥak of the house of Rabbi Ammi said: It teaches that the Shekhinah was jingling before him like a bell. It is written here: “To stir him in the camp of Dan,” and it is written there: “A bell and a pomegranate.”

sentences.text: ״בֵּין צׇרְעָה וּבֵין אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צׇרְעָה וְאֶשְׁתָּאוֹל שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים הָיוּ, וַעֲקָרָן שִׁמְשׁוֹן וּטְחָנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
sentences.human_translation: “Between Zorah and Eshtaol.” Rabbi Asi says: Zorah and Eshtaol were two large mountains, and Samson uprooted them and ground them one against the other.
sentences.llm_translation: “ ‘Between Tzor‘ah and between Eshta’ol,’ ” said Rabbi Assi: Tzor‘ah and Eshta’ol were two great mountains, and Shimshon uprooted them and ground them, this into this.

sentences.text: ״וְהוּא יָחֵל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
sentences.human_translation: and he shall begin to save Israel Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says:
sentences.llm_translation: “‘And he shall begin to save Yisrael,’” said Rabbi Ḥama in Rabbi Ḥanina:

text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה, מֵאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם הוּא כּוֹתֵב?
מִ״וְאִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ וְגוֹ׳ וְאַתְּ כִּי שָׂטִית תַּחַת אִישֵׁךְ״,

וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״. וְכוֹתֵב: ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה. וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה מַפְסִיק.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב אֶלָּא ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה וְגוֹ׳ וּבָאוּ הַמַּיִם הַמְאָרְרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּמֵעַיִךְ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה הַכֹּהֵן בַּסֵּפֶר״.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְרַבּוֹת קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת אָמֵן.
וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כּוּלְּהוּ כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, ״אֶת״ — לְרַבּוֹת צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֶתִּים לָא דָּרֵישׁ.

וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — כּוּלְּהוּ בְּמִיעוּטֵי דָּרֵישׁ לְהוּ. ״אָלוֹת״ — אָלוֹת מַמָּשׁ. ״הָאָלוֹת״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מֵחֲמַת בְּרָכוֹת. ״אֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״הָאֵלֶּה״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי צַוּוֹאוֹת וְקַבָּלוֹת.
וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דִּמְרַבֵּי בֵּיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הַאי הֵי דְּמַעֵיט בֵּיהּ?
הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)רִיבּוּיָא — רִיבּוּיָא (הִיא), הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)מִיעוּטָא — מִיעוּטָא.
וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִכְּלָל לָאו אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ הֵן?
אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: ״הִנָּקִי״ כְּתִיב.
דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה זָכוּ — שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. לֹא זָכוּ — אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן.
אָמַר רָבָא: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא — הַאי מְצָרֵף, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף.
אָמַר רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? זָכְתָה — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, לֹא זָכְתָה — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ.
דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה.
וְהָאִיכָּא נָמֵי עֲפַר כִּיסּוּי הַדָּם!
הָתָם הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה אִיכָּא, הֲנָאָה לֵיכָּא.
דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין.
בִּשְׁלָמָא רְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
אֶלָּא חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת, מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה תְּכֵלֶת מִכׇּל מִינֵי צִבְעוֹנִין?

מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתְּכֵלֶת דּוֹמֶה לַיָּם, וְיָם דּוֹמֶה לָרָקִיעַ, וְרָקִיעַ דּוֹמֶה לְכִסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּרְאוּ אֵת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתַחַת רַגְלָיו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה לִבְנַת הַסַּפִּיר וּכְעֶצֶם הַשָּׁמַיִם לָטֹהַר״, וּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַרְאֵה אֶבֶן סַפִּיר דְּמוּת כִּסֵּא״.
מַתְנִי׳ אֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא עַל הַלּוּחַ, וְלֹא עַל הַנְּיָיר, וְלֹא עַל
הַדִּיפְתְּרָא, אֶלָּא עַל הַמְּגִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּסֵּפֶר״.
וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹתֵב לֹא בְּקוֹמוֹס וְלֹא בְּקַנְקַנְתּוֹם, וְלֹא בְּכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁרוֹשֵׁם, אֶלָּא בִּדְיוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמָחָה״, כְּתָב שֶׁיָּכוֹל לִמָּחוֹת.

גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה שֶׁכְּתָבָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה — פְּסוּלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָתְיָא ״תּוֹרָה״ ״תּוֹרָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ הַכֹּהֵן אֵת כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ וְעַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט״, מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם — אַף מְגִילַּת סוֹטָה בַּיּוֹם.
כְּתָבָהּ לְמַפְרֵעַ — פְּסוּלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתַב אֶת הָאָלוֹת הָאֵלֶּה״, כִּי דִּכְתִיבָא.
כְּתָבָהּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתְּקַבֵּל עָלֶיהָ שְׁבוּעָה — פְּסוּלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ ״וְכָתַב״.
כְּתָבָהּ אִיגֶּרֶת — פְּסוּלָה. ״בַּסֵּפֶר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: When comes to write the scroll from what place does he write?
from “If no man has lain “But if you have gone astray while under your husband,

And he does not write “Then the priest shall cause the woman to swear but he does write “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, and cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” but he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen”
Rabbi Yosei says: He does not interrupt

Rabbi Yehuda says: He writes nothing other “The Lord shall make you a curse and an oath And this water that causes the curse shall go into your bowels, And he does not write “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen.”
With regard to what do disagree? They disagree concerning the verse: “And the priest shall write these [ ha’eleh ] curses [ et ha’alot ] in a scroll”

Rabbi Meir, reasons: “ alot ,” actual curses. “ ha’alot ” to include curses that come on account of blessings, “ eleh ,” to exclude the curses that are in Mishne Torah , “ ha’eleh ” to exclude the commands and the acceptances “amen”
And Rabbi Yosei It all as you, said; “ et ” to include commands and acceptances,
And Rabbi Meir does not interpret et

And Rabbi Yehuda, he interprets all of as exclusionary: “ alot ” actual curses “ ha’alot ” to exclude curses that come on account of blessings. “ eleh ” to exclude the curses in Mishne Torah . “ ha’eleh ” to exclude commands and acceptances
But Rabbi Meir, what is different this heh that it amplifies and what is different that heh that it excludes
heh when near an amplifier is an amplifier. heh when near restrictor is a restrictor.
But Rabbi Meir does not from a negative you infer a positive
Rabbi Tanḥum says: It is written: you shall be free [ hinnaki ]”
Rabbi Akiva taught: a man [ ish ] and woman [ isha ] merit the Divine Presence between them. they do not merit fire consumes them.
Rava said: And that the woman is stronger than that the man. What is the reason are joined but they are not joined,

Rava says: For what did the Torah say: Bring dust for the sota ? she merits a child like our Patriarch Abraham will emerge from her, as it is written with regard to dust and ashes” if she does not merit she shall return to her dust,
Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said: “And I am but dust and ashes” his children merited two mitzvot: The ashes of the heifer and the dust of the sota .
But there is also The dust covering the blood
There, does accessory to the mitzva there is no benefit
Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said “That a thread nor a shoe strap his children merited two mitzvot: The thread of sky-blue and the strap of phylacteries.

Granted, the strap of phylacteries as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head,
But what is the thread of sky-blue As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about sky-blue from all other colors

because sky-blue is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the sky, and the sky is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is stated: “And they saw the God of Israel; and there was under His feet the like of a paved work of sapphire stone, and the like of the very heaven for clearness” and it is written: the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone”
does not write upon tablet, and not upon paper and not upon
diftera , rather, on a scroll as is stated: in a scroll”
And may not write with gum [ komos ], and not with iron sulfate [ kankantom ], nor with any substance that makes a mark but with ink as it is stated “And he shall blot a writing that can be erased

Rava says: A scroll of a sota that one wrote at night is unfit. What is the reason derived “law” “law.” It is written here, “And the priest shall execute upon her all this law” and it is written there, “According to the law, which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment, Just as judgment by day, so too the scroll of a sota by day.
If one wrote out of sequence, it is unfit, as it is written: “And shall write these curses as they are written
If one wrote before accepted the oath upon herself, is unfit, as it is stated: “Then shall cause to swear and afterward “And shall write
If one wrote as a letter, it is unfit, the Merciful One states “In a scroll,”
llm_translation: **Mishnah:** He came to write the *megillah*; from which place does he write?
From: “And if no man lay with you, etc., and you, if you strayed under your husband,”

And he does not write: “And the kohen shall administer an oath to the woman.” And he writes: “May Hashem make you for an imprecation and for an oath. And these bitter waters shall come into your innards, to swell the belly and to cause the thigh to fall.” And he does not write: “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen.”
Rabbi Yosei says: He would not interrupt.

Rabbi Yehudah says: All of it he does not write, but only: “May Hashem make you for an imprecation and for an oath, etc.; and these cursing waters shall come into your innards, etc.” And he does not write: “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen.”
GEMARA: With what are they disputing? With this verse they are disputing: “And the kohen shall write these curses in the book.”

Rabbi Me’ir holds: “alot” — alot literally. “ha’alot” — to include curses that come on account of blessings. “elleh” — to exclude curses that are in Mishneh Torah. “ha’elleh” — to exclude commands and acceptances of amen.
And Rabbi Yosei: all of them are as you said; “et” — to include commands and acceptances.
And Rabbi Meir — “etim” he does not expound.

And Rabbi Yehudah — all of them he expounds by exclusions. “Alot” — alot ממש. “Ha’alot” — to exclude the curses that come because of blessings. “Elleh” — to exclude the curses that are in Mishneh Torah. “Ha’elleh” — to exclude commands and acceptances.
And Rabbi Meir—what is different about this *hei* that he includes with it, and what is different about this *hei* that he excludes with it?
That which is with regard to (that of) *ribbuya* — *ribbuya* (it is); that which is with regard to (that of) *mi‘uta* — *mi‘uta*.
But behold, does Rabbi Meir not have the principle of “from a כלל ‘no’ you hear a ‘yes’”?
אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: Rabbi Tanḥum said: ״הִנָּקִי״ it is written.

דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: Rabbi Akiva expounded: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה a man and a woman זָכוּ—merited— שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן the Shekhinah is between them. לֹא זָכוּ—did not merit— אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן fire consumes them.

אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, and that a woman is preferable to a man, מַאי טַעְמָא — what is the reason — הַאי מְצָרֵף, this one combines, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף. and this one does not combine.

אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? For what reason did the Torah say: bring dust for the sota? זָכְתָה — If she merited — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, there comes out from her a son like Avraham Avinu, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, as it is written about him: “and I am dust and ashes”; לֹא זָכְתָה — If she did not merit — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ. she will return to her dust.

דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: Rava expounded: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, In reward for that Avraham Avinu said, “And I am dust and ashes,” זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, his sons merited two mitzvot: אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה. the ashes of the Parah and the dust of the Sotah.
But behold there is also dust for *kisui ha-dam*!
There, preparation of a mitzvah there is; benefit there is not.

דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: Rava expounded: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, In reward for that Avraham Avinu said, “If from a thread and until a shoe-strap,” זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: his sons merited two mitzvot: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין. a thread of tekhelet and a strap of tefillin.

Granted, the strap of tefillin, as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the LORD is called upon you,” and it is taught: Rabbi Eliezer HaGadol says: These are the tefillin that are on the head.
Rather, a thread of *tekhelet*—what is it? As it is taught: Rabbi Meir would say: In what is *tekhelet* different from all kinds of dyes?

Because the *tekhelet* is similar to the sea, and the sea is similar to the firmament, and the firmament is similar to the Throne of Glory — as it is said: “And they saw the God of Yisrael, and under His feet was like the work of a brick of sapphire, and like the very heaven for clearness” (Shemot 24:10), and it is written: “Like the appearance of a sapphire stone, the likeness of a throne” (Yeḥezkel 1:26).
**Matni׳:** He does not write, neither on the tablet, nor on the paper, nor on the…
ha-Diftera, but only on the Megillah, as it is said: “in the book.”
and he does not write, neither with qomos nor with qanqantom, and not with any thing that makes a mark, but with dyo, as it is said: “and he shall blot out,” a writing that he is able to blot out.

GEMARA: Rava said: A megillat sota that he wrote it at night — invalid. What is the reason — it comes from “torah” “torah”. It is written here: “and the kohen shall do to her all this torah”, and it is written there: “according to the torah that they shall instruct you and according to the judgment”; just as judgment is by day — so too the megillat sota is by day.
If he wrote it backward — it is invalid, as it is written: “and he shall write these curses,” as it is written.
If he wrote it before she accepts upon herself an oath — it is invalid, as it is stated: “and he shall administer an oath”, and afterward “and he shall write”.
He wrote it as a letter — it is invalid. “In the book,” the Merciful One said.

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ לִכְתּוֹב אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה, מֵאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם הוּא כּוֹתֵב?
sentences.human_translation: When comes to write the scroll from what place does he write?
sentences.llm_translation: **Mishnah:** He came to write the *megillah*; from which place does he write?

sentences.text: הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)רִיבּוּיָא — רִיבּוּיָא (הִיא), הֵי דְּגַבֵּי(ה ד)מִיעוּטָא — מִיעוּטָא.

sentences.human_translation: But Rabbi Meir does not from a negative you infer a positive
sentences.llm_translation: But behold, does Rabbi Meir not have the principle of “from a כלל ‘no’ you hear a ‘yes’”?

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: ״הִנָּקִי״ כְּתִיב.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum says: It is written: you shall be free [ hinnaki ]”
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: Rabbi Tanḥum said: ״הִנָּקִי״ it is written.

sentences.text: דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה זָכוּ — שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. לֹא זָכוּ — אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Akiva taught: a man [ ish ] and woman [ isha ] merit the Divine Presence between them. they do not merit fire consumes them.
sentences.llm_translation: דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: Rabbi Akiva expounded: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה a man and a woman זָכוּ—merited— שְׁכִינָה בֵּינֵיהֶן the Shekhinah is between them. לֹא זָכוּ—did not merit— אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתָּן fire consumes them.

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא — הַאי מְצָרֵף, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף.
sentences.human_translation: Rava said: And that the woman is stronger than that the man. What is the reason are joined but they are not joined,
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: וּדְאִשָּׁה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּאִישׁ, and that a woman is preferable to a man, מַאי טַעְמָא — what is the reason — הַאי מְצָרֵף, this one combines, וְהַאי לָא מְצָרֵף. and this one does not combine.

sentences.text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? זָכְתָה — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, לֹא זָכְתָה — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rava says: For what did the Torah say: Bring dust for the sota ? she merits a child like our Patriarch Abraham will emerge from her, as it is written with regard to dust and ashes” if she does not merit she shall return to her dust,
sentences.llm_translation: אָמַר רָבָא: Rava said: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבֵא עָפָר לְסוֹטָה? For what reason did the Torah say: bring dust for the sota? זָכְתָה — If she merited — יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, there comes out from her a son like Avraham Avinu, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, as it is written about him: “and I am dust and ashes”; לֹא זָכְתָה — If she did not merit — תַּחְזוֹר לַעֲפָרָהּ. she will return to her dust.

sentences.text: דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said: “And I am but dust and ashes” his children merited two mitzvot: The ashes of the heifer and the dust of the sota .
sentences.llm_translation: דְּרֵישׁ רָבָא: Rava expounded: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״וְאָנֹכִי עָפָר וָאֵפֶר״, In reward for that Avraham Avinu said, “And I am dust and ashes,” זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת, his sons merited two mitzvot: אֵפֶר פָּרָה וַעֲפַר סוֹטָה. the ashes of the Parah and the dust of the Sotah.

sentences.text: וְהָאִיכָּא נָמֵי עֲפַר כִּיסּוּי הַדָּם!
sentences.human_translation: But there is also The dust covering the blood
sentences.llm_translation: But behold there is also dust for *kisui ha-dam*!

sentences.text: הָתָם הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה אִיכָּא, הֲנָאָה לֵיכָּא.
sentences.human_translation: There, does accessory to the mitzva there is no benefit
sentences.llm_translation: There, preparation of a mitzvah there is; benefit there is not.

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: As reward which our Patriarch Abraham said “That a thread nor a shoe strap his children merited two mitzvot: The thread of sky-blue and the strap of phylacteries.
sentences.llm_translation: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: Rava expounded: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאָמַר אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״אִם מִחוּט וְעַד שְׂרוֹךְ נַעַל״, In reward for that Avraham Avinu said, “If from a thread and until a shoe-strap,” זָכוּ בָּנָיו לִשְׁתֵּי מִצְוֹת: his sons merited two mitzvot: חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת וּרְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין. a thread of tekhelet and a strap of tefillin.

sentences.text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רְצוּעָה שֶׁל תְּפִלִּין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
sentences.human_translation: Granted, the strap of phylacteries as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you; And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head,
sentences.llm_translation: Granted, the strap of tefillin, as it is written: “And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the LORD is called upon you,” and it is taught: Rabbi Eliezer HaGadol says: These are the tefillin that are on the head.

sentences.text: אֶלָּא חוּט שֶׁל תְּכֵלֶת, מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה תְּכֵלֶת מִכׇּל מִינֵי צִבְעוֹנִין?
sentences.human_translation: But what is the thread of sky-blue As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about sky-blue from all other colors
